The fight of these survivors on the train and on some stations is the main plot, centered around a father and his little daughter and a man and his pregnant wife as the main heroes. I liked the movie - camera, acting everything is pro but the movie lost for me a lot cuz some figthing scenes were just not well executed - for example three guys fighting with baseball bats and fists their way through train wagons filled with dozens of infected. No bite, no blow, no wound, it's just simply impossible, it looks like a little bit of a Chackie Chan movie here - trained forces with guns etc. turned cuz they their overruned by the infected but our heroes just get them down with one fist-punch... If u ever had to fight with a mad guy you know what a strength such a man can execute even if you are of more strength and weight. Also the gore level is for my taste rather low - lots of blood yes, but no limbs or guts etc. flying around or flesh bitten out by hungry maniacs etc. So yes, this movie is far far better as all those wanna-be zombie flicks from pseudo-filmmakers with no talent and/or budget but can't beat the elite movies of this genre: a good movie but not in all aspects (some terrible hollow Asian drama scenes) really convincing and in no way the "best zombie movie ever" like some other reviewers stated.

title: Very poor copy of World War Z
review:
I was expecting a good production and a really fun movie. After this my day is worse and I have lost 2 hours of life.
The scenario is terribly bad and also the attempt to plagiarize World War Z.
On several occasions I have seen so bad acting that I had to roll the film in advance because it was a shame to watch it.
I know this is an apocalyptic SF movie but there are a lot of unrealistic situations as well as too much anticipation for the characters to react to some action.
Just horrible.
Do NOT recomend this to anyone!!!

title: One of the worst zombie movies - Don't waste your time
review:
I have no idea why this movie was hyped so much.

All the characters are behaving in the strangest ways, no logical explanation at all. Everyone wants to go to Busan, never mind that the world is going to hell. That doesn't make sense at all. Do they want to get their next connection? What is this? Let not forget that the zombies can fall 50 meters from a helicopter and still attack, but some hits with the bat and they go down? Seriously?

Don't waste your time on this piece of useless art.

title: Not a zombie flick
review:
The "zombies" in this movie are not zombies. None of them came back from the dead. They didn't eat people. And they move fast. These things are the same as the afflicted people in World War Z, in movement and the sheer number of them. They are the result of some kind of infection or virus.

That being said, this was a really good movie. The characters were believable and great. You love the good guys and really hate the bad guy. I was fortunate enough to catch the version dubbed in English so it was very easy to watch. Lots of action and blood. The fact that they were stuck on the train created claustrophobic terror. The end is heart-wrenching.

title: Possibly best zombie fare I have yet seen after Resident Evil
review: If you want to know what Train to Busan is like then think World War Z (2013) without the need to pay homage to Brad Pitt the scientist action hero. Busan is much more a touching tale of an ordinary man and his cute as pie daughter caught up in world slamming events. Those events broil away just as the train is leaving and then spill like angry snakes and writhing intestines at every survivable turn right through to the hold on to your seat ending. Amazing cinematography combined with amazing scenes of thrashing humanity. This one is worth every penny.

title: Really great zombie movie! A must watch
review: This movie was freaking awesome! I have no idea why everyone is mentioning the cheerleader, the movie stands on its own!!! It doesn't need any help from a "pretty cheerleader". Fantastic sci-fi/zombie film.

title: My new favorite zombie movie
review:
Train to Busan was a non-stop trip through a phenomenal zombie film. The zombies were truly frightening, and I felt they behaved very realistically in their mad dashes to their targets. It was reminiscent of World War Z, while also giving more consideration to the limits of the human body. This is the first time I've seen a movie where the dead eyes somewhat affected their vision, and I absolutely love that addition.

The acting from even the child and the minor supporting roles was absolutely top notch. Even the smallest supporting roles were given so much depth that I was convinced the characters were real people. My only dislikes about the movie were how some characters behaved, but it's also very easy to see how some people really would behave that way in that situation, so I don't fault the movie for including them. It was very obvious the actors really connected with their characters' emotions, and it really paid off to create an epic film that was easy to connect to.

Most zombie films show a world where no one has ever heard of a zombie, but Train to Busan was more realistic for the current world. It was fun to see a group that knew the basics of handling themselves, and I loved that, even with this knowledge, they still struggled thanks to some characters' dumb decisions and the total chaos that is expected in that situation. It was an all around fantastic movie that I highly recommend.

title: Must watch
review: I have seen this movie 3 times. One of the best zombie movies! But i rally hates the ceo..

title: Very good film
review:
Lots of action and fun ride Definitely not the typical zombie flicks I'm use to watching In fact... not one bullet was used

The REAL villain of the story was that COO guy who killed more innocent to save himself. I kinda didn't like the how the hero allowed hero dad allowed him to turn full zombie before killing him If anyone deserve to die as a human it was that COO business man

title: Excellent Korean Zombie Flick
review:
This was actually a quite refreshing take on the Zombie genre. Fast-paced, decent acting, superb special effects and all in all a crazy 2 hour train ride.

It showed the ugly side of selfishness, the brutal side of loss, I even cried a bit at the end.

Camera work was great, good score, all in all very watchable. Give it a go!!!

title: Visual storytelling at its best.
review:
Train to Busan is proof that with effective visual storytelling, you don't need exposition. I watched this movie in Japanese with Japanese subtitles, and despite my Japanese being just "Ok" I was able to understand everything the movie was trying to convey. Sometimes simple is best.

The film starts off with a protagonist who comes across as selfish and unlikeable, but slowly becomes the hero as the story progresses. However Train to Busan manages to do this without shoving it down the viewer's throat. None of the characters seem like important people with special knowledge, they're all just normal people in a bad situation trying to survive.

The choice to confine the story on a train, for the most part, helps the viewer feel a sense of claustrophobia throughout the film and it makes every action the characters make a little more nail biting.

While Train to Busan may not be the most original idea, it proves not everything has to be. When done well, even the oldest stories can still make a viewer feel fear, tension, and apprehension for 2 hours.

title: I Laughed, I cried, I was entertained!
review: I avoided watching this one for the longest time because of the subtitles, but with all the action, there's not a lot of dialogue. You go through an emotional roller coaster. There are some sour tarts, funny parts, some sitting on the edge of your seat parts. An essential for the zombie lover.

title: My first experience with a Korean movie was exceptional
review: The movie was awesome! You can not anticipate what will happen. Innovative and originality in every aspect of the story. I highly recommend it ander looking forward for other koorian movies

title: it produces emotions that are hard to reach in China.
review: It's a very common subject, but it produces emotions that are hard to reach in China. The film's portrayal of four key male characters is remarkably successful. The emotions involved in these roles, and the interpretation of human nature by the surrounding dragon sets, make people feel very real. This is a vivid textbook for China. Let speculators like Guo Xiaozi, Deng Chao and articles learn how to make a good film without too many paragraphs, special effects and gimmicks. In terms of shortcomings, Man 1 has a dull expression (as if it was only at the end) and fails to find a new bright spot in the zombie convention.

title: 9 stars
review:
I have to deduct one start from this excellent zombie movie.
Only because i don't know why they cannot wait until night to make the move, when zombies cannot see and they can throw rocks to make sounds to distract the ones that come their way :)

title: Great zombie movie
review: The zombies we're average like, but the story was pretty unpredictable, which makes you to stay stiff on your couch. Well done!

title: Really well done
review: I'm a huge fan of 80's B-horror movies with lots of cheesy gore in it and this movie is nothing like that. This is actually a good movie. The story is nice and touching, there's a lot of suspense, the quality is nice and it's aesthetically appealing to watch. It's just a nice film that's beautifully brought.

title: Amazing!
review:
You would think the age of zombie flicks has passed, considering the market was saturated with them. But then along came Train to Busan and absolutely wreck havoc (in a good way) in this stale genre.

First I would like to praise the director and the crew, considering that they with a very modest budget and insanely short period of time managed to create a fantastic movie!

The cast too was absolutely great, where they would portray several archetypes of human behaviour and succeed splendidly!

Train to Busan, is an amazing, refreshing, action zombie flick. Where the gripping reality and human shame come to light.

If you want a good movie I cannot recommend Train to Busan, because it is a GREAT movie!

Cheerio,

title: Great movie! Good entrerainmetn
review: I love how the film has some good lines also, i mean the script. I love how this films, the good ones, manage to pull out some wise words in the middle of this bizarre situations. Its like the human being when its in the middle of extreme situations somehow gets the real him exposed.

title: Best Zombie Movie
review: Train to Bushan is one of the best movie in its genre. It is a must watch zombie movie.

title: Unorigianal, but entertaining South Korean zombie movie
review: The highest grossing film in South Korea of all time is a routine, but well made zombie thriller. The story begins at the outset of a zombie outbreak with a father and daughter finding themselves on a train to the town of Busan, hoping to escape the zombie plague around them. Unfortunately, the train has a number of folks who are slowly turning intro zombies, so the survivors aboard the train find themselves having to fight their way through the infected cars to get to the safe ones. This story may sound similar to "Snowpiercer," but "Train to Busan" lacks that film's smart political subtext. "Train to Busan" is simply trying to entertain and it does quiet successfully achieve that with tons of fast zombie action, some interesting set pieces, and solid special effects, which is all fine and good if you're into zombie movies. On the downside, I'm not a fan of fast zombies and prefer the slow lumbering Romero-zombies, just as I also prefer my zombie films to have a Romero-style political subtext. So overall, "Train to Busan" manages to come up with some interesting situations and set pieces and does them well, it's all pretty vapid and you'll forget most of the film an hour after you've watched it.

title: One of the best Zombies movie!!
review:
Train To Busan, it's a south korean horror film, directed by Yeon Sang-ho. it lasted 118min ( it's one of the best 118min in my life Xd ). This movie is set in South Korea!
It started with Seok-Woo ( Gong Yoo ) who accepted his doughter's request, which is to take her to Busan to see her mother, because it's Su-An's birthday ( Well.. Su-An is the daughter:) ).. But the journey has been disrupted by a hellish on-board zombie outbreak.. And the real story begins... Who will survive? and How?
I think that it is more than a horror movie, because it shows how selfish, greedy a human can be... And It makes you realize how precious your father is. He is the one who will make many sacrifices for you when no-one will.. 
The ending was especially well-done and sentimental. A child who saved lives through her singing.. Which make me realize that music makes us feel secure..
Overall, ' Train To Busan ' is the best Zombie movie ( It's exciting, emotional and heartbreaking ) with a good child actor! Also the performances are convincing...
If you are a Zombie fan, you should definitly give this movie a try ;).

title: Was not expecting that!
review: I decided to watch "train to busan" because I was bored on a 7 hour car ride back home so I went onto Netflix to find a good movie to watch. It had been on my list to watch for a while so I decided to give it a shot.... wow! I was skeptical because I had never seen a South Korean film but that blew my mind! This movie is definitely in my top 3 of all time and might possibly be my favorite of all time(not counting zombie comedies). The character development was amazing for this type of movie! The zombies weren't too dumb looking which I was afraid would be the case. And it actually had a good ending! The movie was well made and well acted. First time I've had to hold back a tear watching a zombie type movie! Must watch for zombie fans! 10/10!!

title: Autistic Reviewers Opinion Of This Movie.
review: This is without a doubt the best zombie movie we have ever seen! I would say that it is better than Dawn of the Dead. The movie has non-stop thrills, nonstop kills, nonstop action and nonstop emotion. We get to know each character one by one and bit by bit but the main focus here was Seok-woo (Yoo Gong) and his daughter Soo-Ann (Su-An Kim). Their journey to survive the zombie apocalypse made you want them both to live. Along the way we meet many other interesting characters and a very horrifying villain by the name of Yon-suk (Eui-sung Kim). He is by far the most nastiest, greediest and most coldest person you will probably ever meet. He kills so many people along the way in order to save himself from the zombies. The movie is just beyond incredible and it's way better than any is zombie Hollywood movie That we've ever seen! The makeup and effects are just incredible and so passes and he zombie movie with seen since Dawn of the Dead. Only problem English people may have with it is that it is in North Korean subtitles but that didn't bother us one bit as we don't mind reading subtitles. Highly recommended to every zombie fan all over the world and if you want to see excellent character development along with people and characters who you actually care about we highly recommend this film! 5/5 stars

title: Easily the best Zombie flick I have seen
review: Though of course, people would not agree with my assessment, I believe that train to Busan is a well adjusted film with elements of suspense, longing, tension, tragedy, sacrifice and terror thrown into the mix. It is a well rounded movie and the acting performances are above par. This I say when comparing it to movies belonging to the same genre. There is nothing here that hasn't been done before but the way it has been shot is commendable. The ride starts early and the tension does not let up for a single moment. Especially heart rending is the scene towards the end where the father sacrifices himself to save his daughter. It is the sort of movie that stays with you long after the credits role because you start to think - what would you do when you face such insurmountable odds. Again, not something that is unique to this movie but the way it has been done is unique and appealing. Altogether an excellent movie. Now let's wait for Hollywood to butcher it with a remake.

title: frantic. fast moving zombie film, with twists and style
review: i loved this film, fast moving zombies, lots of biting, scary, had me shouting at the screen, ''run run run'', The train situation was great, as they are trapped, claustrophobic, and yet escape is possible,. All the actors did great job,some with comic aplomb. The little girl is an amazing actress. do admit in some places it slowed down, when you would think it would keep racing, with sentimental and melodramatic moments, i guessed these were Korean film culture.but they still added to the anxiety. This film takes zombie films forward,. further then zombie land did, it makes walking dead look amateur. i would recommend this film to anybody except maiden aunts and sissies

title: Make No Mistake - This Is The Greatest South Korean Zombie Apocalypse Film Ever Made.
review:
After having watched the superb film World War Z(2013), I was eager to watch more of the same. Years later I got a chance to see Train To Busan. The quality of the film matches World War Z in every respect. Train To Busan has a different setting to World War Z.

The film is shot at a train station. Therefore all the action scenes are set inside and around trains. If you like films that are set on trains then you'll like this film. Examples are Murder on the Orient Express(1974), Narrow Margin(1990), Under Siege 2: Dark Territory(1995), Unstoppable(2010).

The supporting cast is superb. Gong Yoo plays the central character of the film alongside a host of gifted actors. Ma Dong-seok is another talented actor. Kim Su-an does a wonderful performance as a child-actress.

Note that this is a graphic horror film with intense scenes of gore. People who are new to this genre should perhaps see the trailer to the film before watching this one.

There is a companion animated feature film to Train To Busan: Seoul Station, also directed by Sang-ho, was released less than a month later after the main film.

Want to see more Zombie films? The Living Dead at Manchester Morgue(1974), Shock Waves (1977), Dawn of the Dead (1978), Zombie(1979), Burial Ground: The Nights of Terror(1981), Re-Animator (1985). C.H.U.D.(1984), C.H.U.D. II: Bud the Chud (1989).

Thanks for reading my review. Live long and prosper.

title: In the vein of 28 Days Later -- a great "zombie" movie
review: This is a seriously GOOD movie! You really need to watch this movie if you are into zombie flicks in the vein of "28 Days Later"! I am not well versed in the S. Korean movie industry, however, if this is any indication of future offerings I will be watching a lot of Korean flicks. I don't like watching movies by subtitles but in this movie it didn't hinder the quality or the suspension of reality at all! --- As I said before, this movie is in the vein of 28 Days Later, which was, in my opinion, the first and best modern age zombie flick since the original "Night Of The Living Dead" way back in 1968. I give props to NOTLD because it was the first, but I never liked the premise of those movies, in that they try to tell the watcher that something can actually bring you back from actual death. I am sorry but to my sciences oriented mind that just does not work. However, a plague that turns humans into homicidal psychopathic lunatics is believable in my mind. In fact there are actual examples of such things in nature right now. There are fungi that literally attack an insect's brain and turn insects into zombies that do their bidding in infecting others and moving to the best place for the fungus to send out its spores and such. So 28 Days Later really worked for me and so does "Train to Busan"! And the acting in the movie was great too, especially from the little girl. I have to admit at first I thought this was another Japanese SciFi flick, but after 5 minutes into the movie it hit me that this wasn't Japanese. If this is an example of the S.Korean film industry to come Japan had better get better and fast or just step aside because S. Korea is in the house.

title: One of the best zombie movies ever seen
review: Great movie , and just loved it . But i am a bit surprised that not a single bullet of fire took place to kill a zombie. The pregnant girl was really really cute. Don't know what her actual name is. But just liked her .Her fighting husband and the little girl"s father and herself too . Good movie really to watch . It was a bit surprising about the late inter fair of the defense .But finally they protected the people.The most tragic scene was the father of the little girl"s death .The funny thing about the zombies was their senses were weak . They cant even see in darkness too . After all it was a good experience watching it on my laptop, smoking a cigarette while lights were off .

title: I wasn't crying
review:
Survival element of this movie for me is better especially when its action only happen around the train station, railway and in the train itself (suit with the title) with the zombas(zombies) that for me their faces are not too much. For the audiences that love to 'cut an onion', the family and humanity scenes had touch my heart even my tears didn't fall down. The duration is around 2 hours and I didn't even feel it was already 2 hours after I watched it.

I felt so entertained until I make a big hole of my mouth in the hall and luckily, the hall was too dark and I was sitting far from anybody – I sat in the COUPLE SEAT, alone. Maybe I easily felt entertained with this movie because of the less information I got before watching the movie. I knew the movie had viral long ago and I even knew it was about zombies two or three days before I went to the cinema. I also never watched the trailer. So it gave me a different experience of entertainment while watching it with less information of (it would be the same to another movies). This movie was succeeds to attract me into its universe till the end, and I didn't really find the detail elements of what made this movie was so entertaining to me. It was enough for taking me to the end of the story.

title: The feel, you name it, you will have it
review:
The tension builds up gradually and in a very natural way that you have moved to the edge of the seat without yourself knowing. Be it emotional scenes or racy scenes, the makers have dealt well with the psychology of audience. This is exactly how an outbreak would be. Certain scenes were like a flowering among nightmares. Great acting by everyone. Visual effects were realistic. Cinematography and Editing went hand in hand. Tension, affection, fear, humanity, betrayal, you name it, you will feel it.

I don't think we need six seasons to convey this kind of story.

Hollywood please refrain from remaking this. No, God, No!

title: Excellent thriller, zombie movie of the year
review:
Amazing cast, great cinematography and edge-of-your-seat suspense. Stars very normal and gradually increases in terror. The directing is so well done that you feel every emotion there is to feel. The zombies behavior is very believable, as how they are fast and fearless and unmerciful. Of course the train aspect if it is very terrifying. However, very realistic in terms of people reacting the way they did and dying the way they did. The ending is very simple yet perfect for the thriller that happened previously.

The plot of how exactly its started is still vague. I really hope they make a prequel, where they show people stuck in the beginning of the riot. Showcasing the madness of how it first spread between people and the police. As a group tries to escape, they die one by one until the girl that gets bitten rides the train to Busan.

Amazing job and good work to all those participated 👏🏻

title: A group of people has to survive a train full of zombies.
review: Koreans are good at making horror, and this zombie movie attempt shows how skillful they are. You have fast-running zombies, blood spattering, and selfish people. The film delivers shock value, and decent drama along the way. It feels like World War Z without CGI zombies piling on each other. Being set on a train, the plot is also similar to Snowpiercer, another train horror movie. (what is this obsession with trains, or is it the only place in Korea where the space is cramped?)The acting is decent, and the casts are pretty average-looking; with the exception of the lead actor, which makes the story more credible. The director did not focus too much on morality issues like the Walking Dead, but sets up new problems for the characters to face at different stages of the movie. This makes the plot move quickly and smoothly. The ending was rather conventional, but I guess no one hates a happy ending.

title: Train to Wuhan
review: China is making the sequel. Train to Wuhan! It should be out very soon! Maybe even before the stock markets all crash!

title: Ending ruined it
review: Really, ending pretty much sucked. Was going pretty good until last 10 minutes or so. What more can I say, I hate when they kill somebody off just for some shock value. He fought off groups of them but then couldn't fight off one guy? How stupid and out of character is that. Matter of fact, last 15 minutes or so is where it really got stupid. They should have just ended it with more of the group surviving. So, if you don't mind stupid endings then you will like this. But if it pisses you off when they kill people off for no reason other than some schmo decided it would be cool then pass. It could've been one of the best zombie movies made, but then they had to just go and royally screw it up at the end.

title: Watch out , THIS IS A B-MOVIE !
review: A movie with childish acting and writing in many points , involves all the cliches of this kind of movies with nothing new. I was mislead by ratings and reviews in IMDB and watched it. If you want quality in cinema you can find it in some zombie movies like the recent "The cured" but there is no quality in this one. I was not really thrilled and got bored after first hour. Watchable with pop corn ,friends and laughs if your expectations are low. Obviously overrated and a B-Movie .

title: Run of the mill
review: Some characters die from order of appearance, which is quite predictable. It had a few cheap tear jerkers, like the vulnerable pregnant woman and child losing their loved ones to zombies, Very clichè. The movie tried to send a moral message across to its audience with the main protagonist shown to be a selfish prick at first, but as the film progresses he learns throughout his horrific train ride that he needs to be a caring father. A strange message for a zombie movie I thought. Of course the zombies aren't the only bad guys, as some of the living can be dicks too and they're the ones who get everyone killed whilst getting killed themselves. The last scene was kind of like watching night of the living dead. Overall formulaic and predictable, but fun watch. If you're a hardcore zombie lover, then don't bother, If you've never seen a zombie movie in your life, then you will love this.

title: Zoombastic
review:
A very well made movie that keeps you hooked for nearly 2 hours.
Better than all the zoombie themed movies that I have seen till date.

title: something different
review:
Wow this movie I thought was fantastic, first of all when I'm watching a movie where I have to read the captions wasn't something I was accustomed especially when the film was action packed through out , it's one of my favorites. Love it when
Loved it again when watching it after so many years
Now a days everyone seems to be doing a lot of remakes copy this copy that and want credit for something someone initially came up with the idea
But this movie I don't remember seeing anything like it before and to me that made a great impression and great movie.

title: Fear the commuting dead
review: In this fine Korean entry in the 'fast-moving zombie' sub-genre, a diverse group of survivors find themselves sharing the linear confines of a high-speed train with ravenous undead, hoping to eventually reach safe haven. I watched an English subtitled version, but thought that the cast was very good, especially 10-year old Kim Su-an as Su-an and Gong Yoo as Seok-woo, her fund-manager father who is forced to re-examine his values in light of the grisly apocalypse. The film is somewhat uneven in the capacities of the hyper-animated corpses to absorb punishment but otherwise the story holds together pretty well (considering the premise is a communicable agent that near instantaneously turns a bitten person into a milky-eyed, frenetic cannibal). Well-made and smoothly directed, 'Train to Busan' is an entertaining entry into a generally bloated genre and impressively for a zomboid film, pulls off affecting, almost moving, ending.

title: Highly Overrated
review: Suffers from so many plot holes and inconsistencies.

title: Next Stop: Korean Zombies - Worth getting on for
review:
I've had a big thing for Korean horror films from the 2000s in particular, but of late have lost touch. I was recommended this movie to sit down and watch, and what a pleasant surprise it turned out to be.

Zombie films have been done to the death (no pun intended) over the past decade or two, and there have been some very interesting and enjoyable movies over a number of genres. However, this one sidesteps the problems some others have by having a good director, budget and good cast of actors with a fine script. Avoiding the slapstick, comedy or torture porn route, this is a story about redemption for a father out to protect his daughter and discover the human within. Okay, that's not exactly wholly original (e.g. War of the Worlds etc) but it does have heart and keeps you engrossed.

As per the name of the film, the travellers are stuck on a train to Busan from Seoul along with the zombies, and we have action without too much gore/violence, but really tension and emotion as we watch our protagonists try to survive this catastrophe. There are some cliched characters, for example the older selfish rich businessman and the old couple etc, but really you can't change everything. It still works.

Granted this doesn't have any social commentary like some that made the zombie genre famous, e.g. the Night of the Living Dead, but in its own way it is a refreshing change on the low budget or comedy-centric comedies that have abounded of late in the field. I really enjoyed it. Bit concerned if they make a sequel, but that will be inevitable. Worth a try.

title: Better than world war z
review: Wow this movie was fantastic in every way. A perfectly paced zombie flick with amazing characters that you actually feel for and care about as opposed to others in the genre in which you don't care what happens to them. I can't remember when s horror movie made me choke up like that. It could have been bloodier but that's a knit pick of mine. Dose not affect how good this movie is. So please do yourself a favor and check this one out, especially horror fans, you will not be disappointed

title: Zombie Drama
review:
This review is for people like me who have put off watching this film for a while. Zombie movies are not my thing.

Luckily I bit the bullet, as this is a excellent character film. It is 2 hours of touching moments or upsetting behaviour. The film shows the best and worst of people, which is often true in crisis.

The movie is unfortunately hindered by a few cliches towards the end, perhaps because it was made to be a success at the Box office. Only small directing choices that I feel would be better removed. Character behaving same way three times in around five minutes. A Flashback and what I assume was meant as a 3D moment.

So if, you have been putting off watching this, in fear of just another Zombie movie. Or you love Zombie movies. I hope that you give it a chance as it is well worth a watch.

title: Awesome with Heartbreaking Ending
review: This is one spectacular zombie movie. The acting of all the actors are superb. No cheap jump scares, only genuine and sheer thrills and tensions from most part of the movie. The antagonist in this movie got what he deserved, which was very satisfying to our part as audiences. I was not sure about the little girl's acting skill, because she was like a robot at first half of the movie. But everything was revealed at the end of the movie. And it was really great. It was really heartbreaking when the main actor got bitten at the end. My only regret is that why didn't he use his shoe to gag the old man's mouth, so that he won't be able to bite? Were he to do that, he would still be alive with his daughter and the pregnant lady. Not turned into one of them and threw himself off the train. I cried like a baby when the little girl was crying, refusing to let go of her Dad. It was so sad. Why did they make the main character dead? I think that sucks BIG TIME! And that's the only reason why I didn't give this movie a 10 out of 10.

title: Very little to complain about
review: It's a great Zombie movie that focuses more emphasis on the people rather than the fact that Zombies are running around. Unlike the majority of movies in this genre. Character development is right on the money even for those who only get a short amount of time or lines on screen. I have a few bones to pick with the way things were carried out on 2 occasions in the movie but to an extent it is part of what makes it great because I'm left thinking backwards about how things could have gone differently only if this happened. Then I think further back and say the same thing. It's a must watch. You will be invested in the characters completely.

title: Well I wasn't expecting that
review: I rarely write reviews but felt I had to express my total amazement at this Korean film. I've never watched a Korean movie before but I love films of the horror/thriller genre. Nothing much surprises me these days as I've seen it all before but still usually enjoy them. So I saw this was highly rated and gave it a go. I was locked in from the start. The characters were very engaging and they hook you in their journey. What really stood out for me was the fact this zombie film made me emotional. Horror films don't make me emotional but this made me cry. I am truly amazed as I never expected a Korean film to be such quality. The acting, scenery and special effects were on par of a A grade Hollywood film. The scenes throughout were totally heartbreaking specially at the end. Thank you for not killing them right at the end. My only criticism would be that the three of them should have made it till the end, I am a sucker for happy endings. I loved the character of the pregnant lady's husband, he was awesome and I was gutted he didn't make it. Most Hollywood dramas take seasons to character develop but this film managed it right from the start. Highly recommend it.

title: Train to Busan resembles with Snowpiercer in which both film main setting was on the train but twisted with Zombie Apocalyptic Plot.
review:
Before Train to Busan became popular when it reaches big screen across the globe, I thought It will have a resemblance with Snowpiercer a film which was also directed by a Korean director, Bong Jon Hoo. What's differ with this Train to Busan film is, it is purely Korean made from director to language and it became popular over the social media because of the uniqueness of the Title.

Train to Busan resembles with Snowpiercer in which both film main setting was on the train but twisted with Zombie Apocalyptic Plot. However, just like previous zombie horror sci-fi film, there's nothing special with the zombies in Train to Busan from how it was spread and how zombies reacts with uninfected ones. I loved how the train gives major role in the film however, despite they are inside the train, the story is something that so usual among zombie horror film. One bad point is, they are always in a group; a group with different personality and objectives which for me is platitude to give a thrilling rising in action. Story is not that unique, cliché, plot holes and impossible scenes are present in the whole duration of the film. It's the same as usual zombie apocalypse with no major changes of plot.

Train to Busan is definitely a simple Zombie Horror Film that do not gives adrenaline satisfaction of it's common and bad story line. But still a must watch movie for Zombie Lovers.

title: Scream, shout, and jump about.
review: I had to watch this movie in two parts because after seeing half of it, I was all screamed out. I'm not a great fan of zombie movies, I don't watch Walking Dead, but this film impressed me enormously because the zombies are, first, only incidental to the plot; and secondly, they have allowed the director to incorporate some truly wonderful and bizarre concepts. The film starts in a subtle sort of way. Watch carefully or you'll miss things. It's nice to see how the director uses these half- glimpsed horrors to show the dawning comprehension of the passengers on the train, that something seems to be going wrong with the world. The director Sang-ho Yeon, who also wrote the screenplay, is adept at stretching out the agony to improbable levels as time after time the zombies almost get to chow down on the passengers. But as I said earlier, this is a long film, and there's only a certain amount of time before chowing down does indeed occur, and a whole lot more, besides. The high point of the film, for me, comes when the train nearly crashes headlong into a disaster scene at an intermediate station. Somehow the passengers and driver must find another train to continue their journey to Busan, and - they hope - safety. And now begin screaming again. I'm giving this film 10 points because of so many things, but mainly the sheer inventiveness of Sang-ho Yeon.

title: Tense ride that's well executed and even manages genuine emotion.
review:
This is one of the best zombie/virus outbreak movies ever made. The tension is palpable and builds throughout. By the end I was feeling like I had been running/panicking along with the characters.

During the whole movie there was a perfect balance between the terror and panic, and the fear and distress and emotion that would come with such occurrences. At many points the execution of the zombies and how they move, react, attack was superbly directed and felt far more professional and well thought out that many U.S. movies that churn out the crap rubbish. Often in these kind of movies something happens which breaks you out of your watching because you think 'that wouldn't happen' or 'that's not realistic'. I don't think I thought that once during the whole movie.

By the end I had a tear in my eye (as did the person I saw it with) - I won't say anymore other than the writer, director, crew, actors, all deserve a round of applause for a fantastic effort.

I would suggest that zombie and horror movie lovers in the West DON'T WATCH THE U.S. TRAILER as it reveals too much - it won't ruin the film, but some of the scenes are really great and would be better as a surprise.

title: excellent effects makes it a must see
review:
I was lucky to see this Korean zombie flick before it is shown in our regions on Halloween night. It's already out for months. And I must say that I really enjoyed this must see flick.

Even as it clocks in at almost 2 hours it never had a boring moment. And it do has a few sentimental moments about losing the one you love. And even as the story isn't that strong it all works out fine. It's just a survival on the train that has some zombies running around.

But what makes this flick watchable and above mediocre are the effects used. The zombies do react and move on a weird way, And in the beginning the deer standing up after being hit, wonderful. Also there's a lot of CGI used with collisions between trains but it all looks real. Even the horde smashing against each other it do works.

For all zombie geeks a must see.

Gore 1/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 4/5 Story 2/5 Comedy 0/5

title: Only Z this World War
review:
While these aren't the zombies I'm looking for, the movie made up for every wrong-doing in World War Z.

Train to Busan is an incredibly well-shot, well-acted and well-thought- out zombie/infected film with characters you care about, want to see grow and live. It might have had a low budget, but you'd never know it; this foreign film looked like a major Hollywood movie.

Now, though the many scenes of heart, exposition, depth, setup and introduction to our "heroes" worked really well, the movie was terribly too long. I wasn't really complaining throughout for pacing or length, nor was I wondering if scenes could be cut, but it still went on far longer than it should have. It was almost as if there were 5-6 climaxes and then you realize you still have 45-25 minutes left.

Also, and this is a personal preference, the zombies ran at Mach One speed. Sincerely, I love zombie shows and I'm a purist at heart. The slow, stumbling, "yes, you can walk right past them" kinds are what frighten me the most. The exception to the rule was 2004's Dawn of the Dead remake. They were fast, fine, but the movie's all-around greatness made me forget my hang-up on the bionic-beasts.

And Train to Busan did the same thing. There was so much good here, the zombies were pretty much incidental to everything else I liked.

Basically a divorced and selfish dad agrees to take his daughter to see her mom on a train when the 77,493th zombie-apocalypse begins. (That's not a complaint to how many there are, just a semi-fact. Still love this subgenre!) Unfortunately for the passengers, an infected, bitten, Walker, The Living Dead or Zombie – pick your poison, gets on board and all hell breaks loose.

Unlike most of the Z movies, you will see characters grow and scenes so powerful, it'd be hard not to choke up. I certainly did. And though the film's not without the standard clichés and stereotypical evil/not-evil scared humans, it's easy to also get past those movie tropes since the actors are so strong and believable.

I really, really did like this movie. If you're a fan of zombie flicks and require a lot more depth and sometimes humor, you cannot go wrong here.

***

Final thoughts: Day 2 Movie in the Can! I'm watching a NEW-2-ME horror movie every day of October 2016 and this one I've heard good things about. I actually put it off too long just to save for October. Wish I hadn't; not only was the movie great, it had some incredibly cute Asian men that I wouldn't mind finding more films with them in it.

title: Total Fun-ness
review: I am not big on the zombie genre, thinking 'enough with the whole zombie thing already' camp. BUT...this movie is just too much fun to watch that it makes one more zombie movie incredibly tolerable. If this is the last zombie movie ever made, it will send zombies out with a bang. Okay, maybe it'll be the last zombie movie I'll ever see. Unless there is a sequel. Did I read that there was a movie before this one called "Seoul Station"? Ah, I just read that Seoul Station is an animated film, and I am not big on those either. But, I'll have to find it and watch it now. And now I want to rewatch 'Snowpiercer' and '28 Days Later'. Actually, I want to see 'Train to Busan' again already.

title: Pretty Good
review: Well,I want to do a review about this film warning!contain spoiler! What Can I say about this movie that it actually pretty good not perfect but just nice what I love about this movie is the cinematic value of this film very clean and not very predictable like I being told by everybody who watches this movie.Now I want to tell you about the plot is okay,so many difference character and scripted well.Love the plot that this happen on a train very good even though,I know it's not a real train but but think the CGI is very good now you maybe you think if this film is very good why I give only 9/10 because the ending is not very good and disappointed me not only that I don't agree that only two of people survived and what make me angry is An Son Hee character is death! Why you must kill her F**k you stupid Director! Darn it! But this film is good I recommended it go watch it worth your money P/S climax of this film will make your cry..

title: Very Entertaining and Exciting Movie
review:
This movie is a zombie movie of very different kind.

A father promised his daughter to bring her to her mother no matter what. That "no matter what" was not an easy one, in fact, encountering a lot of unexpected things. Zombies are endemic and widespread. Their train to Busan is no exception where the plot is built on.

It brings the audience to the point of climax and then gives some pause to develop characters vividly. From the very first minute of the movie to the end of it, it is exciting and thrilling, making you curious more and more.

Not a single minute is wasted. Climax after climax with smooth progress of the story line make this movie one of the best thrillers with emotional mixture and full of excitements and curiosity.

I would rate it 10/10 ...

If you have watched an extended trailer, it would be 9/10 I would say it is in the category of "must watch"

title: Good
review: After watching "train to busan", I believe that you can be impressed, remember, is the hero of the role played by kong liu and ma dongxi as a handsome uncle. These two personified human justice. What do they show in the movie as the true heroes of doom

title: Epic.
review:
I liked it!
I've watched it about 4 times now, once with no subtitles. Apart from the obvious cliche in all horror movies - that being how some people are stupid and stare at the drama happening in front of them rather than running - there are no complaints. I liked the acting and I believe the movie was done well, the acting wasn't terrible either. I like how it's similar to World War Z except Train to Busan is based solely in South Korea. Well done.

title: Pretty good
review: This was a descent zombie flick. I enjoyed it, slightly cheesy but very well done.

title: The BEST zombie movie Ever
review: This film blows away all the TV shows and movies about zombies. There's no over the top gory bloody scenes! Just an amazing horror and very intense story. Most of all, the characters! You feel for them. This is a must see. The very best zombie movie Ever.

title: Very Good
review: This movie is so raw is very good made me and my sister yell and cry at the very end it was very emotional and worth it I cried so hard I couldn't see where I was going 10/10

title: Legitimately great
review: I kind of thought I was done with the Zombie flick but upon hearing the buzz for this one I decided to finally give it a go. It was a good decision. First thing I liked is how quick everything took off, the zombies turned quick and they were fast as hell. They also had a great cast. The big dude was my favorite and I got quite a bit of satisfaction when he ran over and elbowed a zombie to the ground in the train station to save the little girl. The main guy evolved as well and quit his selfish ways for his daughter. The end was a serious tear jerker for me which is something I hadn't expected in a zombie movie. Might be because I'm a dad now but it hit me.

title: South korean masterminds ,Best Zombie movie ever
review: Well i not liked zombie movies, watch soo many hollywood movies but was plain,bore this korean Zombie movie was such a masterpiece ,Direction,Script ,Acting,Camera work,visual effects was very solide & with full of emotiones in which hollywood mostly lake off.

title: Not Your Average Gore-Fest Zombie Flick
review:
"Train to Busan" is a 2016 Korean drama/zombie film directed by Yeon Sang-ho. It follows a man named Gong Yoo, his estranged daughter Soo-Ann and other passengers become trapped on a speeding train during a zombie outbreak in South Korea.

I was recommended to watch this film by a close friend of mine, he knows I love horror/drama films and the fact that it's a Korean based film is even more up my alley. Then I found out this was on Netflix, so I finally got to watch it! I can honestly say this is the strongest zombie film I've ever seen, I know that's a huge statement to make since some U.S. based zombie films are well regarded. However I have my reasons, which I will get into.

First of all whatever cameras they used to film this movie I would kill to play around with! This movie was beautiful and so crystal clear in picture. There are fantastic shots done in this film and I really appreciate it for that. Also the special effects themselves were top of the line, that deer at the beginning looked fantastic. Seeing hoards of zombies running and falling over each other like a tidal wave was horrifying, there is so much great tension in this film. Also, the actors they got to play the zombies were fantastic in the way they moved and contorted. The movie also didn't need to use disgusting visuals to get it's point across, which zombie films/series do quite often.

Every character had personality. I don't personally know any of the actors in this film, but they made a lasting impact on me! Everyone was great, but the 2 that stood out the most to me were the dad (Seok-woo) played by Yoo Gong and Yong-guk played by Woo-sik Choi. Both played emotion with such expression and guttural tones that I felt their performances were the most noteworthy. Also... Woo-sik Choi is very cute, so I'll be checking him out in "Parasite" as well.

When character die throughout this movie, you feel the loss. Which is the greatest compliment you can give a film like this. The action and drama flowed very well together, even when the scenes were slower paced I was still invested. Definitely check this one out and give foreign films a chance! Don't use reading subtitles as an excuse to skip fantastic movies like this one, it just makes you look lazy!

title: One of the best zombie films in recent times
review:
Not often does a film surprise me as much as Train to Busan did. I went into it with high expectations, but this movie easily crushed them. As a fan of not only horror movies but also of zombies in particular, this film manages to show the true terror of a zombie apocalypse, using the setting of the tight corridors of the train to its full advantage.

George Romero may have created the zombie genre, but this film truly uses all the techniques at hand to craft a terrifying experience... one that I will not forget for a while.

If you have a Netflix account, you would be wasting it by not checking this film out. Easily one of the greatest films on the platform.

title: One of the best movies i've seen
review: Frankly, i can't believe there are so many negative reviews. Everyone seems to point out that the zombies are fast etc etc but only a few get what's the movie about.

title: Intense and meaningful
review:
So much more than a zombie movie, with ton of themes and emotional scenes. That is by far my favorite zombie movie out there. Some twists and boldness that I did not expect. Overall just a great movie.

But for me the ending kind of fell flat. The fatty just doing so much in a row kind of pushed me away. It looked like they just wanted to kill off people at the end. Also that took away from the emotional drama when he died. But still it was well executed and I did not think that he would really infect the main character-

title: Train to Busan
review:
Seok-woo is a workaholic fund manager living in Seoul with his mother and Su-an, his young daughter. She is desperate to see her mother, who lives four hundred and fifty kilometres away in Busan. Eventually her father agrees to take her and together they board the train to Busan. As the train prepares to depart we are introduced to a few other characters; a man and his pregnant wife; a pair of older women; a school girl and her boyfriend a wealthy business executive; a homeless man who keeps saying 'everybody is dead!' and a girl who is behaving strangely. Soon after the train sets off this girl attacks a train attendant... it is clear that she was infected with something that causes extreme violence. It isn't long before more and more become infected and survivors are barricading themselves in the remaining safe parts of the train. If that weren't enough it is clear that the infection is affecting people throughout South Korea.

I really enjoyed this South Korean zombie film; it provided tension from soon after the start right to the final scene. The zombies are more like those infected in '28 Days Later' than classic slow shuffling ones some people might not be keen on that but I think so long as they are scary all is good... and these provided the scares. The film nicely establishes rules that these particular zombies follow. Inevitably there are plenty of gory scenes, but nothing too excessive, and it isn't entirely obvious who, if anybody, will survive. The key characters are introduced well and fairly quickly; they include a good cross section of society and both heroes and cowards. Setting the film in the confined space of a speeding train adds an extra danger as there are limited places for survivors to hide safely for any length of time. The cast is solid and make us believe in their characters; similarly the special effects are pretty impressive. Overall I'd say that this is definitely a film to watch if you like zombie movies.

These comments are based on watching the film in Korean with English subtitles.

title: Tear jerking scene odd.
review: Overall a good zombie movie. I hate when zombies run, but it makes the movie more suspenseful. However Korean movies have these formulaic scenes where they try to squeeze tear drops out of the movie goers' eyes, scenes daring the audience to not shed tears. Very offputting IMO.

title: Great zombie film even though it's Korea's the first zombie film ever.
review:
Train to Busan is Korea's the first zombie film and also one of the best zombie films of all time. I rarely watch Korean films, but when I saw this film, I was totally surprised because it's the first.

As the film name, Train to Busan, the whole thing happened on the train. So, the filming location scope is small but it turned out great. What I like of this film is it shows if you don't want to die, you'll die quicker than usual. So, we don't need to afraid of dying. We all have to die one day anyway. No one can avoid it.

I really hate that CEO guy. The way he try to survive by pushing all people around him to die is something I hate most. And also I hate Koreans always love to kill off the main character(s), making the film unhappy ending. If they make the film end with some kind of happy ending, it'd be better than this.

The makeup skills, special effects used in this film and performances of actors and actresses are good, so that the film becomes better and better. Even though this film is the first zombie film that Koreans ever made, it's like they had a lot of experiences with zombie films. They could make a great one on the first go.

Although there are some things that I don't like in this film, it still makes one of the best zombie films I've ever watched. It's enjoyable, so, I recommend you all to watch it.

title: Korean Zombies Done Right
review:
I've seen this film mentioned elsewhere and saw it come up in my Netflix recommendations a few times so I thought I'd give it a try - especially since the user rating is impressive for Netflix and it was nominated for and won some awards.

In essence, it's a fairly typical zombie horror flick but the emphasis is a complex family dynamic and mental struggle of survivors on the train from Seoul to Busan. Nobody suddenly becomes a ninja warrior or a military arms expert and not everyone lives to the end of the movie. I think that differentiates it from standard Hollywood zombie fare and makes it more compelling in the end.

The acting is pretty solid and the special effects are (even though sometimes comical) surprisingly high-quality. Even though zombies are kind of played out at this point I'd recommend giving this one a lazy, rainy day viewing.

title: I really great take on a zombie film.
review: This take of a zombie film did very well. The zombies weren't over the top and they moved with a purpose. You also get a real connection with the characters. It is a foreign film so you have to read subtitles, but it was worth it.

title: make me questioning my common sense
review:
About 2.5 years after the release, I watched this movie. Boy, didn't I confused the high score here.

Train to Busan has an original story: how a train survive zombie apocalypse to the end of the road (or in this case, rail). The CGI aren't half bad. The suspense and thrill also keep you on the edge. BUT and this is a really big but, how the characters take decision here is what infuriated me the most. They are - to put it nicely - UTTERLY STUPID.

The story started nice and sound. All good until zombie arrived and suddenly all characters decided to be the stupidest person in the world. Yes, I know zombie and any other life-threathening situation will clouding your judgment. But in this movie, it's just unbelievable idiot. I lose interest through the end of the movie but keep watching (though with high blood pressure).

Yes, yes there are touching dramas here and there but the drama doesn't need to occurred IF the stupid decision was not taken at the very first place. I want to list them here but there are so many. I just can't.

title: Totally worth the wait!
review: I've been wanting to see this movie for a while and its was so worth it. This is the only other zombie movie to ever make me cry. Throughout this movie, my anxiety was up but it was totally worth it. I wasn't disappointed. Now its 1:22 AM and I should get some sleep.

title: The best modern Korean movie !
review:
In Korea ,the virus was dangerous...the korean population was infected by this virus ,so dangerous !
In my opinion , Train to Busan is beautiful and captivating movie.
The score is very emotional,I cry during this movie because the score was very important in this movie ,and emotional for my ears !
I think,this cast was a very good choice! Yoo-Gong is very charismatic and he played very good in general.
If you like or love the action movie,you should see Train to Busan !

title: Korean Zombie
review: We all love Zombie movies but once again Korea brings a fresh take on a stake genre. This movie is non stop action and all the character s resemble society. These aren't your slow rolling Zombies but sprinters who want a pi e of the action. Take this train.

title: The best zombie horror film I've ever watched!
review:
Train to Busan is THE best zombie horror film made so far. It's intense, heartbreaking and it'll keep you at the edge of your seats through the second half of the film. If you're into horror films, especially zombie films, do yourself a favour and watch it! It's available on Netflix right now as of November 2018.

10/10!

title: a masterpiece that stressed me tf out
review:
This film was super well done, but it gave me so much anxiety. Which is intended in this genre, but I feel like it was beyond so.

Most of my criticism doesn't have to do with this movie specifically, but in the zombie movie genre as a whole. For example; a pet peeve that is used in this movie is the speed of the zombies and the high turnover time of the infected. It's just straight not fair.

Anyway. It's a great movie. I just got a stress headache from anxiety watching it. 👍🏻

title: Masterpiece
review:
It certainly has some flaws and leaves certain things unexplained; that being said, watching this movie is a really artistic experience.
The setting is terrifying and brutally realistic; the pacing is fast but not rushed, and the acting is excellent. One of the best films of the genre I've seen in a while, highly recommend it.

title: Awesome Zombie movie!
review:
Fantastic zombie movie, all the way from South Korea! This movie is great! Starts out like a normal day, father/daughter trip to visit the mother (the parents are temporary separated) and suddenly the world comes crashing down town by town. And these aren't you slow walking bizzaro zombies, these babies can run.....FAST!! This movie kept me on the edge of my seat! Who would be infected next? Who would survive? Also, the little girl is adorable!! 
This movie is in Korean, so there are subtitles, but with everything going on in the movie, you quickly get past that and can't wait to see what happens next!

title: All aboard and feel free to move about the cabin
review:
Loved it. I saw a YouTube video about hidden gems on Netflix and they recommended this. I am pretty sick of zombie movies (actually I'm very sick of them) but we were bored, nothing else was on and we decided to watch this.

The pace is perfect, the acting was so very natural and the horror seems genuine. Actress Su-an Kim was amazing as the young girl traveling with her father. There are several strong performances in this and it makes all the difference. There are no dull moments as it the story moves from interesting to threatening to full out nightmare.

You really get pulled into the situation with these people because as I said, the acting is so natural that you feel you've gotten to know a little bit about these people in the short amount of time they are on the screen. My wife never watches horror / zombie movies but this hooked her immediately. There's just something about it that's a cut above most.

Not sure if the other reviews contain spoilers or not but I was glad that I knew nothing about the plot other than it involves people , zombie types and a train.

Watch it , I can't imagine a horror fan not thoroughly enjoying this . A pleasant (not quite the right word) surprise.

title: Subtitles been turning you off? OMG, YOU WILL GET PAST IT
review:
So I had heard of this movie for a while before watching. I absolutely LOVE zombie movies and tv shows. But the idea of having to pay close attention to subtitles, kinda turned me off, as I'm not used to having to do so.
I AM SO GLAD I GAVE THIS FILM A CHANCE.
It is now one of my favorite zombie movies. The acting was incredible. And I love their twist on a zombies weakness. 
Would love to see a sequel to this movie, as it would be interesting to see how people managed with the said weakness.

title: Such a good movie!
review:
I've been surfing Netflix a lot lately and i came across this movie and really had no idea how it was going to turn out. Korean movies especially on Netflix seem to be a hit or miss sort of deal. 
BUT!
This film had such a good and believable atmosphere, it had the ability to make me feel anxious, angry, scared and sad all at the same time. The characters are well written and the story is good. When i wasn't on the edge of my seat I was crying. I love this movie and have seen it many times now. It never fails to make me cry. 
It's definitely a film you have to see if you like apocalypse themes. I loved it <3

title: A throwback to simpler times
review:
This horror/action movie follows a rather typical setting. Confined space and a very personal, limited cast of protagonists. Those are stereotypical .. but not dull. There is character developement .. believable .. as well as sacrifice and heroism.

All is done in a very "natural" .. not forced way. There are manierisms that feel a bit foreign to western culture, i guess .. but nothing that is in the way of understanding the plot. I would guess that an asian viewer might pick up on things a western viewer might not .. but those would only be subtle.

Action is well done with a few CGI effects (regarding the horde) that do look rather odd. Most effects seem to be practical though and the acting is mostly well done (despite the occasional overacting and the obviously overacted "bad guy")

Since it is a very classic zombie story, there are the typical weaknesses of course .. but all in all .. the movie is engaging and very enjoyable to watch .. although not a suspeseful as other horror movies (it was more an action flick in my opinion that just happened to have zombies in it)

title: A Powerful Story About Humanity with All Its Good and Bad
review:
Wow. I'm still crying. This movie was beautiful. I don't mean that aesthetically because as a zombie movie, with all the gore that comes with the genre, it's not pretty to look at. The zombies are all very gross, satisfyingly so to a zombie aficionado but undoubtedly a bit much for the average person. The zombie deer in particular is NASTY the way it twists itself back onto its feet after being hit by the car. But the zombies aren't the point of the movie and aren't why the film is beautiful so I'll move on.

This film explores both innate human selfishness and innate human selflessness in both aspects. Our main character is a father who spends too much time working and not enough time with his (ADORABLE!!!) daughter. He's made himself such a stranger to his child that he buys her a Wii which she already has, and from what I was given to understand he purchased for her a previous holiday(though that may be wrong as I don't speak Korean and the subtitles went by fast). At one point Dear Old Dad flat out tells his kid to only look out for herself, not to do anything as simply kind as to give her seat up to an elderly woman. So Dad starts off in a very selfish place and then there's the other guy, whose name I didn't care to catch, some suited jerk that LEAVES PEOPLE TO THE ZOMBIES REPEATEDLY. Wow, why is it always like that in zombie movies? If the zombie apocalypse does happen, I'm going to be sorely tempted to kick any dude in a suit out of my space before he screws me over. Anyway the selfishness of humanity is on full display when Suit Jerk convinces a car full of people not to help the elderly woman, a pregnant woman and her husband, Dad and his daughter, and some poor kid. He actually gets them kicked out of the car for no reason than his own selfishness and fear. Suit Jerk also sacrifices two train employees to make his escape and throws a teenage girl to the zombies. What a sorry excuse for a human being! But that's selfishness for you and that's not what makes the movie beautiful so I must move on.

It's the kindness and selflessness of multiple characters that won my heart, made this movie a beautiful story and caused me to give it 5 stars. It starts small, the little girl giving up her seat to the old woman but it grows. Dad shakes off his bad attitude after being called out by the Father to Be of the Pregnant Lady's baby and he starts actively helping to save people. Father to Be later pulls a heroic sacrifice to hold a door so the group can get into a train car that doesn't contain zombies, but before he does he shouts to his wife what their child's name will be. I cried. I still am sniffling. And the sports kid, he goes on a mission to free Dad's daughter, the Pregnant Lady and the old woman from a train bathroom with no benefit to himself. He does it because it's The Right Thing To Do. And I can't forget the disheveled guy, this poor man spends half his time tripping or alerting the zombies by making unintentional noise and he pulls another heroic sacrifice to save the girl and Pregnant Lady. IF YOU AREN'T CRYING THEN I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO TELL YOU.

In fact, helping others is the only way anybody stays alive. Everyone who makes selfish choices not only dies, but causes the deaths of those around them(Suit Jerk gets the whole train car full of people eaten). Yes the selfless choice of sacrifice also gets some people killed but they knowingly give their lives so others can go on. The reward is that others live. That's what makes this movie beautiful, it looks at the lesson Dad attempted to teach his daughter at the beginning and it goes "No. Humanity does not survive by looking out for only yourself. Humanity survives by virtue of the courage to help others, to give, to GO BACK FOR PEOPLE, to be a HERO." In a time where it is fashionable to put forth stories where #1 looks out for only #1, where you are told that some people are too slow, useless and not worth the effort, this movie makes the case that salvation is not earned by abandoning your fellow man but earned through being willing to look past yourself and Do What Is Right.

And I'm sure there's symbolism to be found in the child and woman passing through the dark tunnel and being saved by the child singing but I'm too sad(in a good way) by the movie's end to figure it out.

title: Wow, what I solid flick!
review:
I'm not a huge zombie fan by any means but I don't mind a good zombie flick. I ended up watching this because of the reviews and seriously, this is a solid movie. Never boring, not a ton of wasted moments (if any). Super acting. and SUPER zombie effects, movements, etc. Just a very well made Korean film with a good story also.

I 100% recommend this movie, I don't think you'll be disappointed at all.

title: Never thought I would describe a zombie movie as LOVELY
review:
Oh boy, did I love it!! It has everything from action and horror to heartfelt, slightly over the top k-drama music that highlights perfectly the plot. Believe it or not, there is also humor, amazing special effects and, the cherry on the top, the little girl's performance. However, expect stupid things to happen, like people forgetting how to run, people being extra-loud, people not checking minor details like looking behind them, etc. But maybe that's too be expected in a dangerous, totally new situation? 
As a bonus, you MIGHT enjoy the lack of brain smashing scenes, brain goo, heads exploding like pumpkins, etc. so feel free to enjoy plenty of snacks while watching this zombie flick. Overall, I would call it a decent, clean zombie drama, with some horror elements and very theatrical music.

title: One of the Best Pure Zombie Flicks Ever
review: Very few modern zombie flicks are as consistent to the tone and intent of Romero's films as this. Regularly people, living their lives, suddenly faced with terror and death. But where Night of the Living Dead is a slow-burn thriller, this is an edge-of-your-seat action-horror whirlwind. The performances are fantastic, and the final 15 minutes is unexpectedly moving. A little long and sporadically hacky? Maybebut it's mostly just a cool and scary ride.

title: When you think zombie theme is done...
review:
What an surprise, what a trip, what a drama and action! Train to Busan is filmography at it's best. Directed and shoot perfectly, acting spot on, specially Su-An (little girl) and her dad, but everyone else gave and did their best as well, to the point of actually not having any minus to give as a rewiever. True thriller, with deeply emotional ending, specially if you are a parent. Can't wait for part two. Cast is amazing, story done well, although one would think zombie theme is done for good.

It is a must see gem of a genre. I give it a 9 just because of not knowing how outbreak started. If second part gives the answer, I promise to.come back and give first part a clean 10!

You will not regret seeing this one.

P.S. If you go to.see it with girlfriend, at the end of the.movie...act like there is something in your eye, cause you don't want your girl to see you cry. :)

title: Keyword: Zombie
review:
Seok Woo is a fund manager in Seoul. His wife left him and lives in Busan. Seok didn't spend a lot of time with his family, always at work. After screwing up his daughter Soo-an's birthday, he fulfills her wish of wanting to go to Busan and see her mother. During this time there is "a small leak at the plant" which leads to the proverbial zombie outbreak and of course one gets on the train to create havoc for the film.

The film is a bit heavy. It is about family, sharing, and sacrifice...things Seok Woo placed second to himself. He now must work as a team and learn different values to save his daughter. The film becomes a bitter-sweet zombie drama before it is all over. Almost 2 hours long and needs about 10-15 minutes cut from it.

Guide: No sex or nudity. No swearing in the English subtitles, but I think there was some in Korean not translated.

title: Surprisingly very good
review: Im reading some of haters reviews and what can i say, people really don't know what they are writing because they are blessed with primitive brains and from what i red some of them like to eat human flesh :), do you really wanna trust that kind of person? They don't see the point of sacrifice and desperation (i know, this is not a drama, its a zombie movie, but the end is really tense (some said even heartbreaking) if u really watching the movie. I wont give an example because i wont ruin it for people who likes movies of such a genre. Movie is high budget, its not some third-rate American bullshit. Acting always can be better, but its not bad at all. U can always find some bad stuff in the movie, but what movie isn't bad than? Content of movie is tense from the beginning till the very end. So if u love zombie movies and u wish to watch a "good zombie movie", surprisingly this is it. The best zombie movie i have seen in a long long time.

title: While on the train ride to Busan a Father and Daughter band together with the other passengers to Survive from the Infectionous Zombie Outbreak
review: Heard the buzz around this movie and ignored it for a while Finally seen it was on Netflix and thought I'd give it a watch and WOW, I'm blown away on how amazing it is. I'd have to say I loved the Characters,Hated some and the movie had so much Heart, good amount of action and the ending will leave you teary eyed. Overall I'd have to say Train to Busan is an Excellent movie and worth the watch.

title: A Must-See.
review:
I adore this movie. I've watched Train to Busan a couple of times now, and it keeps my attention on it every time.

Zombie movies are almost as numerous as zombie books, it seems. You get to the point where it's like "Okay, been there, done that." So it takes a certain kind of zombie film to make you want to watch it more than once.

Train to Busan starts off a bit slow, but it's necessary. By the end of it, I was rooting for the surviving characters, and cheering for the director and some of the choices that they made. The ending is wonderfully done. The last 15 minutes or so of the film are almost impossible to look away from.

I normally go for Norwegian movies for my foreign film fix, but South Korea is definitely start to get my attention. Train to Busan is a must watch for any zombie-movie fiends out there.

title: A Very Good Zombie Thriller, Worth A Watch
review: This is one of the better zombie movies I've seen in a long, long time. The zombies are scary and the first half of the movie packs a lot of tension. Especially the moments when the passengers(what's left of them) flee from the train and attempt to come out of a station and the utter mayhem that awaits them is probably the best part of the movie. There's good drama too, the notable among them like the father and daughter conversation or that between a pregnant wife & her husband. I was totally hooked until the final few scenes that I felt didn't pack much punch like the initial horror. There's also a particular scene towards the end where a negative character who survived so far finally gets bitten but how he turns while he still begs to be saved looked almost comical in this otherwise intense thriller. The best performances were from Eui-sung Kim as a very selfish passenger and child actor Su-an Kim. Verdict - get your popcorn & soda, and munch away your jitters while you watch this one.

title: More than just a zombie movie, and suspenseful nonetheless
review:
TRAIN TO BUSAN is a zombie movie for sure. But it's also a story about a father and his daughter. And it's a story about greed and sacrifice. This zombie movie has more heart than most other movies of the genre, yet it will also make most genre fans happy by having some pretty darn scary zombies.

I thought this was an all-round solid movie with some scenes that were nail-bitingly suspenseful, effective cinematography, a fast-moving plot, and some decent acting. There's a few cliché moments in there, but hey, that's o.k.! TRAIN TO BUSAN did succeed in conveying some genuine emotions, as well as a genuine sense of dread and apocalypse. I highly recommend it.

title: As good as the genre gets (and that's a compliment)
review:
I just finished a second viewing of this film (the first was at an art house cinema) and during this second viewing, the qualities of this picture became very clear (more so than during the first one). Yes, it does contain the zombie tropes and the characters nicely fall into the stereotypes: the jock, his girlfriend, the bad-ass, the evil businessman, Jordan Gekko, the little girl, the survivor, the old ladies,...

But this is where the movie's strongest asset works: like TWD, it manages to make you care about the characters. The story leaves you just enough time to connect with them. Sometimes with a slice of comic relief, although to the movie's credit, that is not overdone either. It never becomes a jokey joke-thing and that's a quality as well.

Once the zombies come into play, all the right buttons are pushed at the right moment. Timing is a quality not to underestimate.

The moments that are meant to be tension filled succeed in doing so (the actors do a great job at making the characters look determined in their quest to survive) and when it wants to tug at your heart strings... well, it simply does. Some moments (like with Jin Hee and her boyfriend) are touching, but there is a moment near the end between Jordan Gekko and the little girl that is simply gut-wrenching. In terms of emotional impact, it's right up there with Sophia walking out of the barn, if you will. But in a different way.

So, in short, it's a success all across the board. Highly recommended for horror fans.

title: nice movie :p
review: This movie is really good, the only thing that i didn't like was the title i thought that it would be better if it was "Anything that can go wrong will go wrong: The Movie" because it literally does, this movie also gave me crippling depression and i don't know if live is worth living anymore, Thank you :)

title: One of the best zombie movies i've ever seen
review:
If you liked zombie movie World War Z then you will definitely like that one even more.

The storyline is very good 9/10 Zombies are very realistic. IF you love fear and anxiety that movie is for you.

Would definitely recommend to anyone.

title: And old feel to a new zombie film
review:
Firstly I'll like to say this film has kept to the roots of a original zombie flick. Instead of 1000 CGI zombies who you can barley take serous, this film has spent a lot of time in actors and makeup effects that slow the actor to really give a human like movement and belivement in the zombies.

For Asian film fans you will recognize some actors and to be honest the casting was on point.

The only bad thing I have to say is some scenes were a lil unbelievable and yes I know its a zombie film but I think realistic outcomes make films a how lot better.

title: Decent zombie flick. Fresh, but not spectacular. Worth a watch.
review:
