I thought this was a pretty decent zombie flick. The pacing was good, but this is an action film more than a horror film. This was more World War Z than Night of the Living Dead. Some of the scenes were a bit of a stretch of the imagination, but it is a zombie film, not a biopic. There were quite a bit of "feels" which is usually hard to accomplish in a zombie film, and it actually felt pretty fresh without completely rewriting the genre. The movie effectively made you like some characters, love some characters, hate some characters, you get the point.

Something that bothers me about zombie movies is the inconsistency of the zombie mechanics. How fast and strong a zombie is, how fast people turn, etc. This movie is pretty notorious for this. One minute, people take what seems to be up to 15 minutes plus to turn, then next minute people are turning immediately. Zombies are jumping over objects and mangling a group of people, and then in the next scene one man can hold back an entire zombie hoard by himself without a scratch. It definitely pulls you away from the story for a moment.

Overall though, this was a decent film, and I had fun watching it. In the end, this is an action/horror film that should be treated as such. Don't expect everything to make perfect sense and don't expect stellar dialog and acting, although the acting is very decent for an action/horror film.

title: A fun thriller
review:
This is only the second Korean film I've ever watched, (the first one being "OldBoy")and like "Oldboy" I enjoyed this quite a bit. The story is about a father who has a strained relationship with his young daughter, so much so the daughter wants to leave him and live with her mom instead. The daughter wants to ride the train by herself to Busan, the father decides he needs to go with her to try and save what little is left on his relationship with his daughter.

Once on the train the fun truly begins. The "zombies" are relentless and people turn quite quickly after being bitten which I thought was awesome. Another aspect of the zombies was when the train would go through tunnels, the zombies effectively go blind. When a group of survivors need to get through a few of the train cars they use this to their advantage but only have a certain amount of time before the train comes out of the tunnel.

You feel for the "good guys" and there are some comedic moments to relieve the tension with a few one liners here and there. One problem I had was towards the end, some of the decisions that were made by the protagonist weren't really smart compared to the others that were made earlier in the film. But just a minor blip in what was otherwise a fun and entertaining zombie movie.

title: Formulaic zombie movie is still heartwarming and thrilling
review: Well worth the hype! One of my favorite zombie movies because it also told good character stories. Did I cry? Yes. Did I feel it had some points for improvement? Sure, but I can overlook that. Was it unreal at some parts? Again, yes, but not enough to distract from its tension and drama. I'd watch it again and fully recommend it! Usually zombie movies get tired pretty quickly, but this one is a thrilling ride from start to finish.

title: I'll take you to mom, no matter what!!
review:
Here's The Lowedown on "Train to Busan" (NR - 2016 - Korea)...I'll take you to mom no matter what!!

Genre: Horror/Zombie

My Score: 8.1

Cast=4 Acting=9 Plot=8 Ending=10 Story=9 Scare=9 Jump=7 F/X=8 Zombie=10 Gore=7

A father and daughter are boarding the fast train from Seoul to Busan. During their journey the apocalypse begins, and most of the population becomes flesh eating zombies. While the train is shooting towards Busan, the passenger's fight for their lives against the zombies and each other.

"You only think about yourself...that's why mommy left." What an amazing zombie movie!! Think if they crammed all 7 seasons of The Walking Dead into a train...and a 2 hour movie. The Infected zombie effects were great...the way they moved and reacted was pretty unique. This movie is definitely in my top 20 zombie movies of all time!! You'll want to turn the lights out to sneak past the undead as well as to watch the movie...I really liked it.

title: Zombie apocalypse
review: What a film blows the link off on the stuff coming out of American horror and I don't mind subtitles if it's a good movie and this one was excellent the special effects of the Zombie's were amazing so come on America get your finger out and make good zombie film.And the father of the little girl was just bothered​ about is work at first but became a unlikely hero which I just love at the end since I watched it I have watched it another three times since then I just love this film.

title: Very Cool
review:
Opinion about Train to Busan (2016) Train to Busan is a film of the year 2016. Directed by Sang-ho Yeon. Seok-woo (Yoo Gong) an entrepreneur goes on a train to base to see the mother of his daughter (Soo-an). But u zombie apocalypse to prevent them. Passing along with other people must survive on the train. What will? The movie in general I liked a lot. I was as usual with the theme of the zombies. But throughout the film increases the fear of the zombies. The movements of the zombies i found it very good, such as robotic to be transformed.

Another important point of the film is the closeness that one has with the main characters, a don't know not how is called but just as you want it. And that is difficult to do. That closeness to the characters are shown in a trilogy, but here we only have one movie to love them.

The deaths in the film seem to me to be sooooooooo unexpected, which gives a touch of surprise. Not as The Walking Dead, you say "Not that cannot die because it is the protagonist" here that doesn't happen. Anyone can die.

What I liked the most of the film is the pace you take. From start to finish. Sitting quietly on the train, to be fighting against zombies. You should not take your eyes to the screen, because you will miss out on something incredible.

What I found stupid in the movie, is that if the zombies don't see you don't eat. I found it ridiculous. But it gives a new twist to the movie, something more radical.

I liked a lot 8/10

title: An individualist Broker running away from zombies
review: A typical American movie from the Korean's point of view, that's enough to pay my ticket. Beyond the zombie cinematic, and great and atypical action scenes, Train to Busan contains some critics to the western culture. In one of them It makes a critic to the individuality through the role of a Broker, a Korean in an typical American job, who fights for his only life and that of his daughter, forgetting the life of anybody else. Every man for himself or a sense of community. American perspective or Asian fellowship culture.

title: More than any zombie movie
review: Train to Busan is undoubtedly one of the best film of the genre, manages to mix Zombie with Drama very well with a little action, and it is the biggest proof that the Asian cinema is in its best phase, the plot obviously is nothing original, Always the thing about a virus, plus the idea of making a zombie movie where most of it goes on the Train is original and works great, and the characters are well built, the '' protagonist '' is a dumb face but His daughter changes him in the running of the movie, we have interesting characters, I like the character of Ma Donk-Seok too much, he is very funny, he has great dialogues, the makeup is well done, the rhythm is good, and the ending is a lot Well, I found it touching, I went to watch Train to Busan hoping for just one more generic movie, but I was very surprised. Note 9.4

title: An infectious disaster movie
review:
The dead are rising and biting people, spreading panic and infection all across South Korea (and possibly the world) The main character is trapped on a train with his daughter headed for supposed safety.

The zombies are of the fast-moving infected variety but with some very refreshing oriental twists. Once bitten the infected spring up with their limbs at unnaturally sharp angels, as if pulled up by strings like a marionette.

Although this is a zombie movie it has heavy elements of the old 1970's disaster movies I was bought up on. There are some very clear stereotypes who tend to act out according to role. All the characters are forced together in a restricted environment and its not long before zombies become everyone's second biggest problem.

I have seen a million zombies films, I tend to like each one less than the previous but this was the exception.

You are one step ahead of the story most of the way but that didn't ruin my enjoyment.

Think "Day of the Dead" meets "Towering Inferno" with a pinch of "The Grudge"

title: This works extraordinarily well as an action flick with a heart.
review:
First, let me say that I am not a fan of the zombie genre. World War Z was okay, I thought. The Walking Dead bored me.

This Korean movie will likely (like Oldboy) get a US remake so the snowflakes who are upset by subtitles will get to see a Hollywoodized version at some point in the future. No doubt the plot will be changed through committee interference.

In this movie, our protagonist isn't the most likable person... and don't expect Hollywood to leave his character arc untouched.

Enjoy this one in its present form. It does an excellent job with a growing feeling of dread that turns into an all out chase film with twists and surprising script decisions. Some old character stereotypes are worked in, but there are plenty of unexpected turns and clever solutions.

Like The Host, another Korean film I particularly like, there's family drama at the core. But it doesn't overwhelm the sheer ferocity of the action.

title: Great stuff for such a tired genre
review: A rather neglectful father is taking his daughter by train to visit her mother on the day the zombie apocalypse hits. Naturally zombies get on the train and all hell breaks loose. "Zombies on a train" doesn't sound like the most original concept, but writer/director Sang Ho-Yeon not only manages to find interesting things to do with it, he rather effortlessly stretches it out to 2 hours of really intense action ... and he works in some interesting character dynamics too. There's nothing startling here, but it's not predictable and it's actually rather difficult to predict who will live and who will die. Great stuff especially for a really tired genre.

title: WWZ... in Korea!
review:
This flick could be during the WWZ universe, but in another place, South Korea. The zombies behave just like the WWZ zombies. Bite you, 1-2 mins later, depending on the severity of your injuries, and you are a fast running, hyper-athletic flesh eater, pulsating in crowds fighting over each other to get at the living flesh in a undead wave.

Other than the characteristics of the zombies, the movie is quite different from the aforementioned title. The scope is contained to a relatively small band of survivors, trapped on a high-speed train from NW Seoul to SW Busan during the onset of an outbreak.

The scope of the movie concentrates on a 30-something fund manager and his neglected 10-yo daughter, on their way to visit her mother and his ex-wife. Begrudgingly, he accepts this journey in an effort to please his daughter on her birthday, a day in which he gives her the same present he gave her last year. Much tears and reflection sets up the strain between the two and his later efforts to redeem himself.

From here, all hell breaks loose. An infected passenger soon turns the bulk of the passengers on the train into zombies, in a scene very reminiscent of the WWZ airplane scene. The end result is the survivors desperately trying to survive in the enclosures between the train-cars.

Like any good disaster movie, just when you think it can't get worse, it does. That is as far as I will go with the plot, to avoid spoilers.

So, I loved the movie, but it requires you to not think about the logic too much, if you know anything about Korea. The fact that the infection spreads faster than a speeding train. That no guns or military presence is available, despite the fact that every Korean male is required to serve in the military for X number of years. For most western audiences, they won't notice and it doesn't detract from the fun.

A++

title: The best since Dawn of the Dead - remake
review:
The first big budget zombie flick from South Korea. "Train to Busan" is terrific.

Starting slowly like most zombie movies (something is wrong) it takes off and does not stop until (SPOILER ALERT) almost all the main characters have been dispatched. This is non stop action and excitement for almost the entire 2 hours. Just when the zombie genre is on life support ("The Walking Dead " Season 7 is dying and killing all of us in the process), the Koreans have shown that there still is life in the genre.

There are several new elements: (SPOILER ALERT II) most of the action takes place on a train; the heroes have to fight and trick their way to other survivors; the zombies are terrific - a lot of weird jerking around (reminiscent of the priest in the opening scenes of "28 Days Later"); lots of zombies cascading through windows and falling over each other; an amazing train escape sequence you have to see; and numerous other very creative takes on the "Zombie chasing humans" device.

But this is more than just wild zombie action. This is a story about self interest; caring for others; being willing to help; a father's redemption with his daughter, and the struggle between good and evil (naturally.)

I have not enjoyed a zombie flick in many years - this one makes my all time top 10.

If you are a fan of the genre, this one is a must see. You will have a blast.

title: Fantastic!
review: I saw this movie listed on Netflix and had never heard of it before. But as someone who has watched hundreds of zombie movies and am a huge zombie fanatic, I thought I'd give this movie a chance. The last few years of watching zombie movies I have been disappointed with them. But this movie was absolutely fantastic! I would definitely recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys zombie movies. Just watching this movie last night I have recommended it to several people.

title: Moar sombeez
review:
A dead-beat dad is forced to choose his daughter over his work, but as they settle into their train journey a zombie sneaks aboard ...

Bit of a plod as it sets up the emotional stuff, but once the action gets going the story never lets up. This is much better than Snowpiercer, and conveys the zombie satire of society every bit as well as Romero. Plus the emotional moments are truly good. Plenty of humour, but no laughs for me - all in the translation, except the final scene was crying out for a close up on the sniper's face as he heard the singing.

Performances are good, with an impressive turn by the little girl.

Music, editing - good. And the pile-on effects with zombie corpses were effective.

Overall: Good zombiness.

title: Excellent infected horror and one of the better examples
review:
A group of terrified passengers fight their way through a viral outbreak while trapped on a bullet train ride to Busan.

Train to Busan is a blood-drenched South Korean zombie/virus horror, director Yeon Sang-ho and writer Park Joo-suk offer a serious zombie apocalypse yarn. Interestingly most of the bloody, milky eyed and black vein thrilled story is set in the daytime. Joo-suk offers a novel take on the infected, which cannot see in the dark, this makes for some interesting viewing during the more tense scenes especially as the train travels through darkened tunnels.

Sang-ho's twitchy infected are a fast moving reminiscent of 28 Days Later and WWZ at one point there are piles of clambering dead hanging from the locomotive. In addition, this is a decent looking film, not a straight to video, DTV offering, the production values are high and the special effects are impressive. The locations are grounded which adds to the tension and you buy into the characters plight along with the punchy surprise deaths synonymous with the genre. With mistrust between the players there's a social commentary about the division of class and its pecking order, its only apt it's set on a train.

There are some action packed segments in stations and some subtler moments in tunnels and the city as the survivors encounter the army and contaminated. Surprisingly there's plenty of emotion especially between workaholic Seok-woo played by Gong Yoo and his young daughter, Soo- an, delightfully played by Kim Su-an who wants to see her mother. Notable is Ma Dong-seok who plays Sang-hwa, a tough, working-class man. Dong-seok delivers some memorable zombie head bashing moments.

Sang-ho balances the intense infected action and drama perfectly. Highly recommended virus film.

title: Not just another zombie movie
review: Please don't miss out on this one! I saw this movie months ago and it still resonates.. A Train to Busan is not just a thrilling, fast-pacing zombie movie - it is as much so about friendship, love, introspection,... in short all the things that separate us from the Undead. Korean filmmakers have a clever way of mixing the genres so flawlessly (comedy, family-drama, horror), that you'll find yourself crying and smiling at the same time. The build up is perfect (The opening scene in particular is very memorable- amazing special effects). Some of the scenes are heartbreaking, the girl in particular acts astonishing well and you'll find yourself on the tip of your seat vowing for that train to make it to Busan.

title: A thrilling ride through and through
review: Striking cinematography coupled with an engaging story drives this films adrenaline filled narrative of fully realized characters, nail biting sequences, and heart wrenching moments. Sang-ho Yeon does an incredible job with the film, and the actors give equally masterful performances. Watching the film I did feel as though there was a slight translational discrepancy between the Korean of the movie and the English subtitles, and that the movie held a slightly different meaning in its native tongue that couldn't be realistically kept across the translation. This did not detract from my experience overall and should not deter potential audience members. A must-have to any zombie movie watch list, this film cant be missed. Be warned however, 'Train to Busan' is not for the feint of heart, prepare yourself, and find someone to hold close, you'll probably be glad you did.

title: A great horror action zombie film!
review:
Horror movies were never the same after the zombie trilogy by the director George Andrew Romero. In Night of the Living Dead (1968) we were presented to zombies who eat human flesh, a thriller mixing horror and social criticism. In the second film, Dawn of the Dead (1978), besides the social satire about paranoia and humanity to the brink of apocalypse, the movie explores the comic potential of zombies, especially black humor. We are the headless and cannibalistic beings who roam the cities. Closing the trilogy, Day of the Dead (1985) continues with the social criticism and the comic tone, but relies on a more depressive and gloomy scenario, apart from the use of graphic violence. Following the footsteps of George Romero we have the gore Braindead (1992), the horror 28 Days Later (2002) and Rec (2007), and in humor genre, Shaun of the Dead (2004), Zombieland (2007) and Død snø - Dead Snow (2009).

The South Korean movie Busanhaeng (original title) or Train to Busan (english title) focuses on horror and action, with some moments of suspense. Written and directed by Sang-ho Yeon (known for the zombie animation Seoul Station - 2016), the film tells the story of a financial sector executive, Seok Woo (played by Yoo Gong, known for Do-ga-ni - Silenced - 2011) who agrees to travel with his daughter, Soo-an (represented by Soo Kim-an), from the capital Seoul to the city of Busan for she spends some time with her mother (Seok's ex- wife). After embarking on a modern express train (KTX) passengers discover that an epidemic is raging South Korea, turning much of the population into zombies. With an infected person on board and the disease rapidly spreading, father, daughter and other passengers will have to fight for survival and for their lives, trapped inside a high-speed moving train.

The director Sang-ho Yeon does a great job, managing to immerse the viewer in the plot. Despite most of the action been set in a train the film has a dynamic narrative and impresses for its visual and technical accuracy. Unlike the slow zombies of George Romero's trilogy in Train to Busan they are extremely agile, threatening and lethal. Another highlight is the cast. The characters are well developed, even for a horror movie and the actors deliver relevant performances, especially Sang Hwa (played by Dong-seok Ma, known for Joheunnom Nabbeunnom Isanghannom - The Good, The Bad, The Weird - 2008), the girl in the role of the daughter, Soo-an Kim, and Yoo Gong acting as the father. The soundtrack and sound effects are moderate, providing genuine scares.

There are still some elements in the movie of South Korean culture, as the obsession with education and study, and a strong critique of modern society. The quest for professional success even at the expense of family and leisure time is questioned in the film, as well as the social tension. Moral and ethical conflicts involving empathize or not for others and follow or not the animal instinct of self- preservation are exploited by different profiles of the surviving passengers.

Despite having some clichés of the zombie genre Busanhaeng is a great horror film, with good moments of suspense, well-constructed action scenes, a well-chosen cast and the right amount of tension to captivate the viewer.

title: a total waste of time.
review: I have no way of making up for the time of my life that I have wasted watching this movie; nothing more to say; a total waste of time.

title: Decent, but lacks any real innovation.
review:
This movie was quite entertaining, but really lacks any innovation or originality. It's pretty much just another zombie movie. It really adds nothing to the genre. I just wish there was more about this movie to take in, but there's not. I don't see myself ever rewatching this movie, it just isn't that great.

The characters are all just okay. As most would agree, the big Jackie Chan-looking guy was the best. The main Dad character was pretty bland. His ending arc was kinda cheesy, like a typical Korean Drama.

Then we have the typical over-the-top d-bag villian. The writers went out of there way to get the audience to hate the guy as much as possible. I don't know, just seems cheap, in my opinion. Th villian was pretty lame and cliche.

But what's up with so many people gushing over the pretty cheerleader? Don't get my wrong, she is quite pretty, but too many people are making a huge deal out of her beauty when it's not even nesscary. Guys acting like virgins who's never seen a pretty girl before. I've even seen reviews that just talk about this girls looks, and barely review the movie itself, then they rate it like a 9/10 or 10/10, LOL! Why would someone base a movie review off the looks of just one character? That doesn't make sense for a movie review.

But for all the characters, they lacked real actual character development. They are all kinda bland, one-note, and with not much real growth. But the movie is more focused on just them escaping zombies. This movie would've been amazing if they developed the characters more and had some originality for the zombie genre.

The movie is still worth seeing for the amazing special effects and suspense. It's best watched with friends or girlfriend. But movie is nothing of substance that will stick with you, for me at least.

title: #1 Best Blood Thirsty ZOMBIE Movie Ever Made - Real Fast Moving S.Korean Zombies
review: 04/09/2019 This is a real docu-movie that was made in N.Korea, not S.Korea. How could I know? I was there and I'm pretty sure that I saw Kim Jong Underwear. You'll know him right away, he's the fat one running (kinda slow) with the brown stains in his skivvies. That's from the back. Up front he's the yellow belly. These Zombies are the really fast scary ones, the Kimberleys knot sew scare-we. I escaped by hiding in the toilette. I mean down deep inside the toilette where there was a great big load of **** just like the **** that I've been feeding you in this review. Excellent movie, my third watch. Bon Appetit

title: Touched the bottom of the heart.
review:
Great movie!!!!

Man I'm just fully mesmerized..

Not a typical zombie movie. It has everything which a movie needs to be great. It has action,thrill, emotions. A very heart touching. Director just nailed it.

title: Must watch
review: I cried a lot at the end go for it not that scary.Watch it without any second thought. Just watch it you are missing some quality stuff acting is great everything is over the top love it

title: One of the best zombie movies of all time! IDC! IDC
review: It's been a while since I've seen a really good movie and a really good zombie movie at that. But Train to Busan is LIIIIIIIT!!! I was exhausted by the end of this movie. Everytime you though you catch a little break, BAM! Something else goes wrong. It was a never ending thrill ride! If you are looking for something truly entertaining to watch, this movie is it!

title: Wow- Great Movie, hands down!
review:
This is one of the best zombie movies I've ever seen, and I am proud to say I've seen over 95% of what's out there.

The cinematography is top notch, even somewhat overwhelming at times (wait until you see the zombies tumbling over each other). Frankly, I've never seen a better representation.

Loved the cast, the character "Sang-hwa" is my favorite (he's AWESOME), but not by much -- I really loved the entire cast.

Stay until the end, it's worth it.

title: Bloody" awesome! # 1 zombie movie , must see
review: The best zombie film I've seen in a long time. With its ultra fast piling over each other infected undead it is more in the style of World War Z than TV's The Walking Dead and also does not have the latter's extreme gore. There is enough blood and violence so it is not too light for a hardened zombie fan but focuses more on tension and action. It also managed to build up the characters so I cared about them and once that happens the tension stakes are that much higher. The main characters are a business man and his young daughter on a train when a zombie apocalypse begins. Death while infected causes people to instantly turn so one infected girl on the train causes the infection to spread like wildfire and very soon two groups of survivors remain, separated by infected carriages. Edge of the seat tension and many action set pieces follow as the smaller group tries to get to the front of the train and things escalate in all sorts of ways with some unexpected turns, big action, all building to a powerful climax. I loved it and was gripped from start to finish, I'm a big zombie fan and it did not disappoint. It's serious in tone and has some great character drama with some decent arcs and things play out in ways that have just a slight spin against Western expectations. The zombies are really well done, not too heavily made up (they're fresh) but they move well, all twitchy and sometimes freaky spasms, very fast and lethal. It is Korean language with subtitles but is not dialogue heavy. The DVD also includes behind the scenes footage and 2 trailers for the director's forthcoming Seoul Station which is a cartoon that appears part of this same undead world.

title: Amazing!
review: Just amazing!! If you are a big fan of zombie movies, you are going to enjoy this. Since the 90's that i hadn't watched something like this. Great characters, intense, funny and with a lot of surprises. The movie breaks the typical script, off course that it has the typical clichés of the zombie movies but its shown in a different way. There are many situations that you never expect. The characters are natural, indeed you can feel close to them( that's a good thing when you are watching a movie), and its not usual in this kind of films. Also has the "corean drama" included but in a fun way (just my perception). I was surprised, and when a movie surprise you, you know that they did good their job. :)

title: One of the greatest horror movies -- I was shocked it was so amazing.
review:
Tonight, I was looking for a movie to watch on my InfinityTV.

I have always liked horror movies and I came across "Train to Busan" (2016).

That's right--a modern one for a change.

This is a Korean movie, shot in Korea. I watched it in English subtitles.

This is a horror movie with a zombie theme. I know that makes it sound very cheesy but the write-up on it made it sound like it might be different.

It was. That is an understatement.

This was a beautiful film. I cried at three points. There is a strong love story and life lessons about bravery/ethics for others.

It has to be one of the greatest horror films I have ever seen.

I will never forget it.

That's right--a horror zombie foreign film in English subtitles. It was unbelievably good. The zombies were overshadowed by the stories and the rest of the movie.

If you are able to come across it, I extremely highly recommend it.

title: Exceptionally Well, Really a heart throbbing Zombie Meeting
review: You can't get your eyes and mind off the screen when you are watching this great piece of work, what an sensational movie, and performance from full team. You are engaged with the movie like what's gonna happen now? Hats off to the entire team , loved their work and best Zombie Movie ever, the plot was really very well executed, and was "Heart-throb Bing" Really a Thriller and Most Engaged movie i have ever seen. The little girl singing at end made me cry, I was like at the end "WTH I think no one will be survived, as they will be shot to dead by the military over there , but no!!" I literally cried watching that scene, and was feeling the pain. Thanks a lot for such an movie, we need content like this. Cheers.

title: Last train to mediocrity
review: I don't understand the reviews here. Do people came to watch teenage girls in skirts? Why are the ratings so high!? Definitely in my top 3 worst "horror movies". I cannot believe how stupid actors are. It's all full of unbelivibly stupid decisions. So many inconsistencies. And bad acting. Even the make up are bad. Please, if you like coherence and real horror movies, do not waste your time on this.

title: Terrible movie
review: Worst experience in horror movies. Just terrible. Not recommended at all.

title: Haunting and breathtaking.
review: Both emotional and terrifying, it is the best zombie film I've ever seen.

title: Just another Zombie movie
review:
Don't know what the hype is about? It's just another zombie movie with zombies running amok. Probably the 2 differences that one could be excited by are 1) The zombies run fast 2) The movie is in Korean Apart from these 2 distinct features I couldn't find one part which stood out as a feature that would make me recommend this to anyone.

*SPOILER AHEAD* They just show the infection (which starts randomly) and shows survival (which is mostly running/hiding). That's it. Nothing more nothing less.

title: Too bad to watch. Don't waste your time
review: I just made an account in here to say to the others that this movie is the worst movie I've ever watched. The recorded rate is totally misleading.

title: Overrated Korea
review:
"28 Days later", "28 Weeks Later", and both George A. Romero's "Night of the Living Dead"and "Dawn of the Dead" (And also Zack Snyder's remake) – these are the great movies of the horror-zombie genre; although we could all agree that Romero started it all. Then in 2016, in the south of Korea, we got another zombie flick. I can't tell on how this movie was being received worldwide, but here in Singapore, the 'praises' for it is a bit overdone in my opinion. The result is predictable as neo-musical genre 'K-POP' is popular here. So, any entertainment that shows intimacy with the mentioned phenomenon, will get extra attention.

A young fund manager (Gong Yoo) agrees to bring his daughter (Kim Su-an) to Busan to visit her mother. Since the child's parents are separated, I assume the two parties occasionally meet one another. From the start to the point upon the boarding of the train for Busan, the movie is well made. 'Zombies' in norm only needs one infected for the thrill to start. Hence, in "Train to Busan" an infected manages to secretly board the train.

Director Yeon Sang-ho's effort in exploiting small details can easily be admired. The images of emergency vehicles, the all- encompassing violent fires at the near top of a building and ashes steadily settling down from it – all allow audiences to sense something unsound had happened, although we all know that it is the omnipresent of zombie outbreak.

That's it. After the first zombie begins to bite, the movie goes into a nosedive motion. Action sequences are surprisingly bland; I cannot specifically describe on what's lacking but it lacks genuine excitement. The writing for the characters too shares the same fate (especially the villain) as they are clichéd. What "Train to Busan" tried to depict on the 'colours' of its characters had already been done by dozens of movies before; worst when it lays out that idea before our very eyes and never challenges the audiences. And visual style is straight terrible. The only element which remains to be positive is the effective use of suspense throughout the movie.

As a zombie-genre fan, I quickly got for myself a ticket to experience it at the cinema but only to leave the hall feeling disappointed. My criticism does not mean I abhor Korean movies. Movie fans in general would know that Koreans had made great films for the past years. One of them is "I Saw the Devil" by Kim Jee- Woon, which is a masterpiece in any way. But unfortunately this "Train to Busan" is vastly overrated.

Cinematicmadness.blogspot.com

title: Exciting
review: Exciting movie! Was a bit sceptical in the beginning with the zombie thing but I saw it - and I liked it! Full of action and emotions and you are going to empathise with some of the characters. I had the thought of it being really predictable but it caught me by surprise, actually only predictable few times and that made it enjoyable.

title: Action packed from beginning to end!
review:
Although zombies typically had been slow in the past with them being the "buried dead", etc., you have to admit that zombies have evolved in movies so much since the '80s. What movie would be this intense with zombies that you could easily outwalk?! With that being said, these were pretty frightening and that's saying a lot considering there wasn't much gore to go along with it. The special effects weren't too over the top and there were plenty of pretty realistic bits to everything. In comparison I would say these zombies are similar to ones in World War Z or 28 Weeks Later.

The difference between this movie and those other 2 is that this storyline is much better. There wasn't some special person on a special mission or anything extravagant. It was a normal dad and his daughter as well as other seemingly normal people going on a normal train ride that ends up being far from normal. Although no character was super special, it was still action packed and as realistic as you can get with zombie movies. To me that's what made it so amazing. Bonus points for actually killing off a main character since that usually never happens!

There is also something to be said about the little girl. She was phenomenal for being so young and added so much to the movie. I didn't expect a movie like this to be so emotional, but she sure made it that way with several scenes. More notably when her dad got bit. That was a tough scene to watch because her emotions felt so real.

All the other actors were great as well! I don't believe there was a single one that really sucked. Although there isn't much background with every secondary character, you still gather enough information about who they are as people as things progress. This helped with the very intense scenes where one would die off.

I don't watch many Korean movies, or many other foreign films for that matter, but this has me wanting to watch more. The only difficult part was having to read subtitles and possibly missed some stuff by doing so, but there was so much other good to this movie that I didn't care in the end. Even for it being a pretty lengthy movie, which is usually a huge turnoff for me. Surprisingly I kept up from start to finish!

An issue I noticed that was different than others was that there didn't seem to be a certain timeframe that one would turn rabid once they got bit. It seemed to vary depending on who got bit and where we were in the movie. It could be more intense that way considering you don't know when it will happen. Or it could be a bit of a plot whole. Just depends on how you look at it. There was also a little inconsistency with breaking glass being that sometimes they could break through and other times they couldn't although the glass is all the same.

Another weird/confusing bit was when they went through tunnels and the zombies all of a sudden couldn't see. When that happened the zombies literally went mute pretty much and stopped attacking. But they could hear things still. The only problem I had with that is they made a point to say that they got angry when they saw the characters still alive. So do they get angry off seeing them? Or is it the noises the people make?? It seemed to be a little weird to have that part in there and didn't make much sense to me watching it play out.

Besides those few negatives, this movie still had so much else to offer. I would still recommend to anyone that's into zombie-type moves. Really glad I stumbled upon it!

title: Good and evil
review: The wave of people represented by bad uncle is selfish, dark, and ugly? So what do the groups of people from the upper, middle and lower classes represent when the old, weak, sick, pregnant, and even the homeless suddenly come here? Representing the positive energy of all strata in the disaster from the dispersal of the people to the concerted effort? What about the "bad guys"? What class it represents, from the character setting, seems to be unable to explain why, I do n't understand why the director should put together several types of people, and then sacrifice one by one. The male leader of the highest class is the originator of this city-wide zombie virus outbreak. Why can he rescue a group of "good and just" people, at the end sacrifices himself to jump off the train, and then give a heroic feeling? Punch you and give you a piece of candy to cure you, you are a good person

title: Fantastic Disaster Film with Zombies in it!
review:
Fantastic Disaster Film with Zombies in it!

Thrilling with likable characters you actually care about. Non-stop action thrill ride. And it hits you right in the emotions toward the end. Oh, and zombies bite people a lot.

I will say they missed a perfectly good opportunity to name the film "Zombies on a Train."

title: Just another dumb Zombie film
review:
Dumb. Dumb. Dumb.

The film's plot is just dumb. The film is made up of every cliched zombie plot point. All gobbled up in one single movie. It's just what I say lazy writing. No character development (urggh I know this is a zombie movie but still) Somehow few small events are supposed to define the characters present in the movie. But that's not how things work. If you are selfishly saving your ass and then suddenly if a girl lectures you to "always think about others", you can't become the Hero of the Humanity in a second. You can't write full character arcs in a film which is just showing events of few hours. (I mean you can but you need to be a very great writer to pull that off, in this case it wasn't). And just because of this lack of character development, I wasn't entirely rooting for anyone to get saved (to be honest there were times when I was wishing no one survives in the train).

And what is this obsession of killing each and every character in overtly melodramatic way? I get it people are dying. But if that is happening so frequently as in this movie then I can't cry for every character's death.

The only thing which was impressing were the zombies. No back story. Lethal. Ready in no time (But yet there were some convenient exceptions). And dumb. Just like the entire film.

title: Feelt like watching a cheap Bollywood movie
review: The movie is quite weird and bad, maybe considered good for a zombie movie lol

title: awesome!
review: Frist of all, I did not have any idea about South Korean movies. So, it was my first South Korean movie. Some of scenari was very horrible and scarrey. By the way actor and actress done good job. Over all it was fantastic. Thank you director for nice movie.

title: Best, Scariest Zombies + story with heart = Brilliant movie
review:
Really enjoyed this, most amazing, scary physcho zombies I've ever seen combined with wonderful core characters all wrapped up in a tragic but heartfelt multilayer morality tale.
Superb movie, just see it!

title: AMAZING
review: Movies NEVER make me cry, but this storyline is so realistic, and has so much emotion in it. Everything about it was so good, even the small parts including "She will understand why you leave for work so much, and fathers sacrifice themselves, Because its their job." Even the part when su-an (The little girl) Doesnt finish her song because she wanted her dad to be their, At the end she finishes it for him because she wants him to be their as su-an and yu-mi escape to freedom. This movie is amazing and i would recommend this to anyone.

title: Best zombie movie ever!! Know that!
review: If u haven't seen this film, do yourself a favor. Hurry! Go! I mean it!! Perfect zombie movie: terrifying zombies, wonderful characters, good good guys, grrrr! bad guys, funny at times, surprises, etc. So much fun. Thank you Yeon Sang-Ho**

title: Terrific Film
review: Terrific film! Had everything I wanted for a Saturday night flick. I can't wait to watch this one again. I really think it had something for everyone. Finally a great fun horror film again for me. Mu last few horror flicks have been killing me!

title: Something Old Something New many things borrowed it made me blue.
review:
It was a hit it didn't waste any time to get to the point. Terrific intro to the main characters. Quickly into survival mode. Humans are fearful dumb and heartless. Humans are brave smart and compassionate. This movie truly delivered.
Ailin Lizeth - RMF

title: Love and Death
review: It's just an amazing film that shows the growth of love through experiences together. Not only does it have a good character story, but it also has a good plot and setting to go along with it. Definitely would recommend.

title: One of the best modern zombie movies
review: Train to Busan is a simple yet effective film. The visual storytelling is excellent. Objectives are clear, great pacing, the characters make decisions, decisions that have some semblance of internal logic guiding them. The main characters have arcs, and the action is tense and exciting. There are a few memorable and well written escape/tactical scenarios that are lacking in a lot of action movies today.

title: Why in 2016, a Wii???
review: All in all, a great take on the Zombie genre!! Excellent scenes of violence and Gore. Fast paced and fun. Just one question, why did the dad buy a Wii when this movie was released in 2016?? Wii U and switch we're already out. This is the only problem I have. Lol. Love this movie though ^^

title: Zombie movie
review: Nice movie. The plot and acting is awesome and should film 2nd part.

title: a horror film and a drama in one package
review:
Actually a very good one in both categories. Korean cinema has given some very good movies in the past -starting from the excellent "old boy"- and has already been recognised as an asset in movie industry, so it would be rather foolish to undervalue its films as coming from a country far too remote, far too culturally different, far too unknown to pay some attention to its productions.
I started watching this film with no prejudice but also not been sure of the quality of what i was to watch. Right from the begining it was apparent that it was a serious production and not at all a cheap cartoon style film from a "third" country. And so it proved to be till its very end: A very well made zombie/horror film and not at all only. Through the story line and using the zombie issue as an excuse and cause, there was a very clear and interesting effort to point out the contrast of "good" and "evil" in human nature, and that is among living humans themselves. You add to this the really tender family drama unfolding along a very well and quite realistically made adventure and you have a film which captures your attention from the very beginning and finally leaves you very moved and in tears.
Last but not least: The excellent acting -the little girl will break your heart especially in the final scene- and the amazing, musically simple yet really imposing, epic music score in the ending credits.
Do watch it, worths every penny of it!

title: Best Zombie Film EVER...Period
review:
Train to Busan Review

This was THE BEST zombie flick I've ever seen (and I've seen a lot). It's hyper intense, emotional and heartbreaking all at the same time. I've never seen anything quite like it.

I absolutely LOVE how it shows the rapid decline of civilization. One minute people are just normal people. The next minute those same people are leaving children and the elderly for dead just to save their own skin. It's visceral, disturbing and ABSOLUTELY realistic (which is something zombie movies rarely are).

The movie is extremely fast paced and rarely takes its foot off of the accelerator. This keeps you on the edge of your seat, and always wondering what's going to happen next.

The director did an excellent job at painting a scenario where no one was safe. You feel the same way about the characters too. You really don't have any clue who's going to die next, and that's SO refreshing to me.

If you're like me and love all things zombie related then you HAVE to watch this film!

title: The best zombie movie of all time
review: This movie is unlike any other. I know you're probably saying this sounds generic like any other review I've read but let me change your mind. I'm an advid movie viewer and I haven't seen something so intense yet breathtaking in a horror film such as this one. From starting off seeming generic to completely throwing you off and taking you on a journey you didn't expect. It's breathtaking art work and character performance captures the essence of the viewer and delivers something emotionally engaging that rarely comes from movies especially a horror movie. Please give this movie a chance because it's definitely worth a watch.

title: Glad I gave it a go
review: I nearly turned it off at the beginning due to it being subtitled as I am not a great lover of foreign movies. I am so glad I didn't. Best Zombie movie I have seen in a long time and I have seen a lot! The story line was really good which I didn't expect as most of the action is limited to a train. The acting was believable. I didn't like the Sang-hwa character at first but he grew on me. I found myself caring for the characters and wanting them to survive this apocolypse. Well done to all the cast and crew for giving us a great train ride of a movie.

title: Amazing.
review: The claustrophobic nature of the train mixed with the intensity of World War Z or 28 Days Later styles of zombies makes for an exciting viewing.

title: Finally! A modern zombie movie with someone to root for!
review: 8.2/10 Fun, flashy, emotional and inventive. Very fitting for a group watch, it's pretty easy to get involved. It tackles all known zombie mythos, but still manages to make them feel fresh. Movies set in 1 location can be either very efficient or lazy and this film is everything but lazy. If you want to get scared, pick something else, this is more of an action romp with zombies. The most surprising thing is how likable the characters are. It's a treat to have someone to root for.

title: Better than Hollywood Zombies
review:
Although it is made in Korea, the essence of the story is far more meaningful and emotional than those of a Hollywood zombie movie. The drama is very touching. I've never felt so sad watching a zombie movie before. The entire scene from start to finish really consume you. Just like those Divergent trilogy. Even though it's a 2 hour movie, you just can't get enough of it and wanting for more. Like it should be a 3 hour movie. It really hooks your attention to it.

The characters are convincing. The zombies are reacting logically. Every aspect of the movie is just logical and reasonable. There's no hyperbolic scenes which usually happen in a Hollywood movie. This Korean movie deserves to rival top class Hollywood zombie movie.

title: Investigate humanities ego-tripping psyche in a zombie movie
review: I believe this is the best zombie film I've seen so far. It is not overdone, like so many of the big screen zombie films are. There is some kind of outbreak at a facility and people are evacuated. During the outbreak day a girl is going to visit her mother in another place. To reach the destination she has to take the train to Busan. This trip turns out differently than expected. During their trip there is a outbreak of a zombie sickness. People simply turn into zombies and try to eat non infected people. This outbreak also happens on the train. How will they handle it? Is there any way to survive this train trip and reach the destination? There is a lot of blood and splatter and if you are a sensitive person this is not a film for you. But if you adore zombie movies, this is one of the better ones. It is not overcooked, no this production is just right. It is enough of everything. Somehow this movie also investigates how far you are willing to go for your self interests. Are you willing to help other's on your way? Or are you ego, just doing what benefits you, even if that means other people dying? Somehow this is about how we people turn on each other in crises. So who are you, the good samaritan or the self-centered asshole? Well, I guess Train to Busan just puts all these things on display. You might even learn something about humanity watching this zombie movie. Interesting right? It's well worth seeing this movie. Sit down, be on the edge for a while. The grade is a grade set where I compare it with other zombie movies.

title: Great action filled movie
review:
I can't possibly see enough Zombie movies before I die so I jumped into this one with few reservations even though it almost totally takes place on a train. The director did come through for me with excitement and gore aplenty .

Asian action movies tend to be very direct and stereo-typical. There's usually a strong lead, a very evil character, pretty girls who require protection, and lots of cannon fodder bystanders.

TRAIN TO BUSAN has all these hall-marks and, since I really love the Asian style, I really got into it.

A few scenes were quite spectacular in the ferocity of the Zombie attacks. The carpet of zombies hanging off the back of the train was inspired. Also the scene where zombies were boiling through the carriage, covering every surface, was very effective.

This is a great action movie. The only thing I hated was the subtitles.

title: Absolutely flawless
review:
(If my English is not flawless, sorry. Second languish)

A tiny tiny bit of spoilers!

Firt of, there are two kind of zombie-movies. The one where the zombies are slow, instinct-based. The second one is where the zombies are like rabid dogs. This movie is the latter. Whichever one you prefer, it kinda doesn't matter because that isn't the most important part of this movie. What is, is how fast you start to care for the characters, which is where most horror-movies fail. And the writers has been really smart here. We have the father and his daughter, the pregnant woman and her husband and the elderly sisters. All of which, we as human are naturally inclined to wanna protect. Therefore we care!

Train to Busan is fast paced, thrilling with non-stop action. This movie sailed right to the top of my all time favorite zombie-movies and to the top 10 of my favorite horror-movies. Absolutely flawless!

title: Blows WWZ Out of the Water!!
review: For me, this is one of THE BEST in the zombie genre. Fast paced, adrenaline pumping... plenty of "jump" moments... I'm yelling at the screen... Damn, what a ride. And it mostly takes place on a train. I thought this was better then World War Z by a mile. The entire movie was very well written; all the scenes fell into place. A very predictable ending but who the heck cares, it was that much fun!!! I very seldom buy movies but I want this one for my shelf.

title: Excellent
review:
Greetings from Lithuania.

"Train to Busan" (2016) was hands down the most involving, intriguing, nail biting and visceral experience I've seen in many moons, considering this so called "zombie" genre. It has more in common with "28 Days Later" then G.Romero zombies and even "World War Z" influence is pretty obvious. But "Train to Busan" was by a moon better then "World War Z" - at running time 1 h 50 min. i wished it didn't ended and that happens rarely in movies these days.

This is a superbly crafted picture from start till finish. The first ~50 min where nothing short of spectacular - great special effects, superbly constructed action / chase set piece at the station, clear character development and very clear and involving narrative. Second part of the film was just great - a nail biting horror / thriller.

Overall, if you do like zombie movies - "Train to Busan" delivers goods - big time. This is one of the best if not the best example in this genre in some long time. I wasn't a sequel.

title: Top 3 zombie film ever!
review:
Fantastic film that has good story, good characters, good acting and excellent atmosphere.

The cast are pretty much perfect for their roles with each taking their characters personalities to a point of rare realism. OK, is was in Korean which may mean some things were not picked up by non Korean speakers that may give a different perspective but the action was fast paced and the plot pretty solid.

Excellent entertainment and the zombies, while now familiar to audiences with their expected behavior, did not disappoint and were a cross between Dawn of the Dead stupid and I am Legend relentless and dangerous.

The main setting being on a train suggested the plot would struggle to hold your interest for too long but the sub plots between the characters and the realism of the action made it easy to stay with the story all the way through the film.

Add to that a side portion of just good fun and this is easily one of the best zombie films there is.

title: One of the better zombie movies
review: Second Korean movie that I watched this week and again it won me over. For a zombie movie, that has been done over and over again, this one is much better then most of the other zombie movies. With zombie movies you always get the same story with the same slow pasting zombies. In Busanhaeng though the zombies could compete with Usain Bolt over the 100 meters. They are fast and extremely aggressive. And that's only a positive thing for the suspense in a zombie movie. So it's absolutely not like in The Walking Dead where there they are literally just walking and a grandmother with a wooden leg could outrun them. I can't remember any name of the actors nor understand a word of what they saying but I have to admit that there are pretty good actors in Korea. Overall I would give this movie a seven star rating but as a movie in the zombie genre it deserves an eight because it's way better then other zombie movies. Great acting, a good story, fast aggressive and bloody action, you won't get bored for a second.

title: Now this is a zombie movie
review: First of all, Let's depart from the stereotypical zombie movies while using the common denominator: Outbreak. Starts off well, shows us some key actors and engulfs us in the story in an emotional and interesting manner. We have two main leads, the father and the child, and a vast array of secondary actors. The movie is exceptional not because is good but because it has a very twisting line. You may think a favorite character will live but he/she wont. Imagine Game of Thrones, right? They die a lot. Now add zombies, add a high speed moving train, add a yakuza, some teenagers and the cliché "pregnant lady". Of course add the drama between parent and child and a WHOLE LOT of blood and gore, with no expense saved on special effects, no double the same zombie "I CHECKED". The movie is blockbuster material. Watch it, you'll love it. Regards, Syrus Gregorio.

title: No ordinary horrible film
review:
At first sight of this film, especially the trailer, i thought it was some sort of film which looks like World War Z, apparently they have the same background, fast running zombies in the city.

However, when the film reached the time the zombies appearing inside the train, you will notice how the people reacted, this is the right moment of humanity, what will people choose at the critical moment of life and death, selfishness, lack of compassion coming into screen one by one.

Despite these, you will also find how a selfish father, who always thinks of himself in the first place without paying attention to the people around him, turns into a thoughtful person, caring for people unknown to him and also co-operating with them with a hope to survive. It's hard to describe all in detail and hope you can enjoy this film in depth.

title: An entertaining instance in an otherwise dead genre
review:
I am not a fan of Zombie movies, like some of the other reviewers on here, which says a lot about the entertainment and production value of Train to Busan when I can safely say I thoroughly enjoyed it.

It's nice to see Zombies away from that post-apocalyptic urban setting where most of them would be in dark alleyways or lurking in abandoned apartments. Here we are in a train with a bunch of likable and memorable characters as the zombie outbreak happens, and there's little suspense but plenty of quick action in each scene. This is again an accomplishment since quick sequences of action one after the other is harder to get right without leaving mistakes for the audience to point out.

That doesn't mean this movie doesn't resort to many zombie tropes, in the sort of way that makes you think it is consciously doing so. But that's all fun and good. The fast, bone cracking zombie acrobats are also captivating.

For me, it's biggest accomplishment would be to put so much emotion and meaning in the death of one character at a point in the film when most of the audience would be desensitized to death. Yes, this movie was the first in a LONG time to make me tear up.

So, whether you like Zombie movies or not, give Train to Busan a try. It may not be entirely logical, but its good fun and easy on the eyes.

title: Don't dismiss this movie as another foreign flop
review: I'm not a fan of movies coming out of Asia, they are usually awful: badly acted; poorly shot; terrible script; etc.. But I was drawn by the stars being quite generous and thought I'd give it the usual five minutes chance and I'm glad I did. It was very different in style and feel from the get-go - not your usual grainy, poorly edited rubbish. The movie kept me gripped from start to finish and I hate Zombie movies! Here's the other amazing thing... I had no subtitles and yet I watched it in full! It takes some movie to do that. Yes the plot-line wasn't exactly challenging, but even so. It just had me hooked. The acting was excellent, particularly, the minuscule actress, Kim Su-An, who steals the entire movie, particularly the last few minutes - an award-winning performance. Yes, the ending is a little overly emotional, but I guess that's how it is with some foreign movies. People who are saying detrimental things about this movie are simply not remembering movies like: World War Z (the plot line of which is so fantastical it beggars belief). The simple fact is that this is the best zombie movie I've ever seen. It's well worth seeing (with subtitles). I only have two foreign (non-Western) movies in my collection: Enter the Dragon and this one! If you like gore; horror and zombie movies - you won't be disappointed.

title: A touching movie
review: I knew it's a movie about zombie, but I didn't expect it's such a touching movie. I can see the humanism through the whole movie. The little girl just so king and touches my heart many times. Tha main male character have an other movie also strikes my heart, too. Many people just care about themselves and are very selfish. In this movie is very ironic that those people are all killed at the end.The people who has kind heart want to save people as more as possible. I watch the husband and his sacrifice, I started to cry. I watch the little girl's tears, I started to cry. There is something imperfect is that when they escape from the crash of the train, it's so coincident that it came another train, it's a little too dramatic and unrealistic. Anyway it's a really good Korea movie.

title: Physical and mental catastrophes on the way to Busan
review:
I was actually very excited for this movie to be released, because I would've never imagined a zombie movie made it Korea, that's even set in a very-Korean setting- the train to Busan. The trailer was really interesting and the movie was even better. Some things that distracted me were some points in the story which I didn't quite understand why it had to happen and some frustrating parts.

I also was a little worried how this zombie movie would turn out, how the effects might not be very realistic, and how it might be just one of those cliché Korean dramatic movies. However, it was much more thrilling and focused than I had expected it to be. The situations were realistic and somehow relatable to what can actually happen in Korea, and the rest of the world even. Not as in the zombie virus spreading, but what could cause people to die and how people would react to such calamity.

The reaction of the people was actually one of the best parts of the movie. Unlike most zombie movies, that focus more on the grotesque effects and horrifying happenings, this movie focuses on the psychological conflicts between the people and within oneself. It is quite tragic what happens in the movie, but that makes it more sensible and realistic. I could really get into the mood and the nervous terror of the situations in the movie, and of course, with the aid of some great actors and actresses.

title: Train to Busan is a racy zombie horror with engaging screenplay,brilliant performances and music.
review:
Train to Busan/Busanhaeng(2016): Zombie genre horror have became very common all over the world.We can find them in every country(even in India). So gradually their popularity declined with monotonous subjects.Train to Busan,a South Korean movie tried a different way by boarding zombies onto a fast moving train.So how is this movie??

Plot: Sok-woo and his daughter Soo-ahn are boarding the KTX, a fast train that shall bring them from Seoul to Busan. But during their journey, the train is overrun by zombies which kill several of the train staff and other passengers.While the KTX is shooting towards Busan, the passengers have to fight for their lives against the zombies.

Plus Points:

1)Screenplay and Direction: Screenplay of this movie is so racy and thrilling.There is no dull moment in this 1hr58min journey.The way the characters are introduced and their emotional journey is perfectly blended in this horror.Sang-ho Yeon did a splendid job by bringing a new style to zombie genre.

2)Performances: Everyone did splendid job.Soo-Ahn,who played the little girl is adorable.In climax,her performance is heartwarming.

3)Music: Jang Young-gyu gave brilliant music to this movie.At several moments his music played key role.

4)Cinematography: Cinematography by Lee Hyung-deok is commendable.

Minus Points:

1)Predictability: Though this movie is highly engaging,it is predictable journey most of the time.We can easily guess who survives at last..

So,Train to Busan is a racy zombie horror with engaging screenplay,brilliant performances and music.

My rating 7/10

title: A fresh ride abroad the familiar zombie flicks
review:
First of all I really enjoyed this fresh zombie movie.

Let me clear of the way some nasty points I think you will have to overlook in order to enjoy the movie.

First of all it is for sure not "the best zombie movie ever", basically it is a nice zombie movie, what is, at least for my taste, really good for this kind of movies. Furthermore, the makeup and/or masks of the zombies is not realistic or cool at all. For sure you won't miss the blood stain in the orange color. This movie doesn't follow the same rules as the usual Hollywood movies. It seems very important to the director to point out some ethical views, unfortunately the same aspect over and over.

So what's left?

I think some pretty nice and fresh ideas. I really like the minimalist setting with the train. This doesn't give the story that much space and I think "not that much of space" is a key point in Zombie movies. Despite the expected little space for storytelling the Story is not getting boring at all.

At the end you may say "Well, this was an enjoyable movie" but you will also report some scenes of the movie to a friend with a surprisingly high motivation.

title: Personally, I really love this film
review:
People may snark as the plot of the movie, which is fine, look at it for what it is as far as a story.

But, this does something that most modern films don't, characters develope, the story unfolds, the theory of relativity actually exists in this universe!! It's almost unheard of in western horror movies, where 'a person does this, and then this stupid thing, after this idiotic decision'. And that's modern cinema in the west.

Train to Bus an makes sense from start to finish. It'd MINT!

I've seen it three times, twice when drunk. Still brilliant.

title: Brilliant...Zombie lovers will surely love this.
review: This movie is far better than many Hollywood zombie apocalyptic movies.

title: It makes you feel like a character.
review:
First of all. WOW! I watched it with a concern that it would just be another zombie movie where flat main characters fight zombies for no purpose other than their survival. I was totally wrong.
The main characters are introduced quite well at the begging, and well developed during the movie. For example the dad. A fund manager by the name of Seok-woo, is shown since the start that he is not a guy that spends time with his daughter, he shows it by giving her a Wii when she already had one. During the duration of the train "adventure" the son and daughter develop a relationship that was hidden inside of both of their minds. All of that is shown when the dad is bitten, the kid does not want to let him go. 
In the end everything about this movie is great.

title: Stuck on a Train with Zombies and Nowhere to Escape
review: "Seok-woo" (Yoo Gong) is a fund manager who spends all of his time at the office which has subsequently damaged his marriage beyond repair. As luck would have it, however, he happens to have his young daughter "Soo-an" (Su-an Kim) with him for a few days and to cheer her up agrees to accompany her on the morning train from Seoul to Busan to be with her mother. However, upon boarding the train they discover that a zombie apocalypse has just started in Korea and that they are trapped inside one of the passenger cars with no ability to escape. As a result the uninfected passengers are forced to band together to keep the determined zombies as bay. Now rather than reveal any more I will just say that this was a fairly solid zombie film which emphasized the ultra-fast variety in lieu of the typical slow-moving type. Because of that the action is quite brisk which initially worked quite well for the majority of the film. Unfortunately, I must admit that the non-stop action tended to become somewhat tedious after a while. Likewise, the rather poor ending didn't exactly help in that regard either. In any case, as I stated earlier this was a decent zombie movie for the most part and I have rated it accordingly. Average.

title: Explain this, cause it's not make any sense for me..
review:
This is a big major fatal failure for the script : Factor "x" was causing the differences time for humans infected after they got bite from zombies or what??

For example how can one got bite and instantly infected while others not.. I mean, come onnnn... They still fully conscious after got bitin... And whooppss... One of the support character even can hold the door for maybe 2 or 3 minutes with all of his strength after got bitin and show no infection symptoms instantly? Not mention the main antagonist character may open the door while his eyes was into zombie eyes???? And... Last but not least....... The main protagonist character even can have a little talk with his daughter, took her to the machinist cabin, and give her a daddy final advise also can memorize something ?.. How can the director and the scriptwriter explain this??.. The cheerleader girl got bite at her legs, and it not took long for her to transform into zombie and bite her friend?????... Hey... I almost forget to mention for the first bite scene instantly transform the train staff in her blue uniform into zombie too!! And... and... The baseball team, who is far younger and I think is fitter in healthy than the main protagonist character also transform instantly after got bitin at the station.. This is one of a crap movie... ...Huhh...

title: Waste of time, unreal story
review:
• Stupid movie
  • funny actors, unable to act per the story
  • weak story, zombies were having different characteristics per mood of story writer
  • predectible end of the movie

title: Blown Away
review:

There are maybe two scenes that are a little silly and don't fit, but you'll over look them because the rest of the movie is so freaking perfect.

This is a MUST SEE for an horror / zombie fan. These undead are crazy man.

title: The Best Zombie movie that I've ever seen!
review: Take notes dear Hollywood. This is how a real thriller should be made. TTB captures your heart from the beginning and keep you there till the end. Great cinematography and amazing performance by the cast.

title: Exciting and deep zombie movie
review:
I see a lot of the other posters commenting on the appearance of the female actresses which I find unusual, however every actor played their role fantastically and embodied them very well. Furthermore, this movie provides a very good social commentary and portrays class differences quite well, exactly to the smallest detail. Also the inter-human relations between people are really well portrayed and quite realistic.

In addition this movie is great due to it being realistic, it does not sugarcoat the "realities" of a zombie outbreak, what can, will go bad at the next turn, and only those fortunate or resourceful make it out alive, as would be in real life.

TL;DR this is a movie filled with constant action which keeps you on the edge, fantastic acting, a great social commentary, and astounding inter-human relations.

title: I'm not crying you're crying..
review: The movie was pretty good, with some cringy moments but that's easily forgiven. It was a hell of a ride, and it actually made me ugly cry. First zombie movie that made that happen.

title: A Father And A Daughter
review:
This movie will one of the best zombie flicks I have ever watched. It begins with a greedy capitalist wanting to have it all, until he takes a train journey with his daughter. That is when the zombie attacks happen. In the movie you are introduced to variety of characters including a husband and his pregnant wife. Two old sisters. A bunch of teeangers. The train driver and the train manager.

The movie is primarily about the father who is a hungry capitalist and his innocent daughter. The zombie attacks are shown in ways that will make you move in your seats. The train and the train stations itself looks like a poignant character in the movie. Amazingly shot .

Though a zombie movie, the transformation of the father will move you. Specifically that last few minutes, where the father thinks of the birth of his daughter, one last time. It will break your heart as well as leave you with goodness. Watch it. But do get some tissues.

title: Very much like black summer but lacking one thing
review: I absolutely loved this movie and surprisingly didnt mind watching it from another language. Normally I hate movies from other languages. The plot seemed extremely good but am pretty upset they killed all the actors at the end of it besides the kid and wife (of the cool dude) of course. Would absolutely watch the next one if it comes out. Overall awesome movie they were just missing a few things and the story line could of been a bit better and not just be in a train the entire time.

title: A rare Korean movie about a Zombie outbreak
review: An excellent film of K-horror's early experiment into the Zombie genre. A businessman accompanies his daughter to Pusan during a zombie outbreak.

title: Hugely inflated and misleading score
review:
With such a hight score of 8, one would think and come with the expectation that it'd be comparable to the likes of Shutter Island in plot, Dark Knight Rises in action and scale, and The Shawshank Redemption in theme, when in reality it was just another brainless rehash of the same plotline of already countless zombie movies that the audience had already seen countless times from the countless releases in recent years...

The only new thing this movie had it going is that only this time they were escaping on a train, which was literally a freaking one to one rip off of the anime Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress.... lol?

Checking what are written in the reviews you'd find numerous 10/10 ratings (lol?) of fans citing and counting no name Korean actors and actress like the back of their hand praising every thing related, jamming in all kinds of adjectives that you'd think you're reading some thanking letter to stars from fanboys or some sort... Jeez, since when is IMDB so infested with Kpop fans?

title: Good acting and intense zombie thriller
