title: Good story, a little boring
review: I like the story and the cast, yet the middle part seems a little boring and tedious, just keep running and fighting for most part of the movie.

title: Want a happy ending? This aint it chief
review:
Or maybe it is depending on how optimistic you are... I enjoy films like this-- where the bad guy is winning over and over again. I hate predictable storylines and I am glad to say this film had me on edge. Also, can I also mention how amazing the tiny actress is? She is going places for sure! I cannot wait to follow the main actors and actress and see what other films they have starred in. The CGI, although not a major detriment, took away my attention slightly and broke the wall between story and film but AGAIN not a complaint, just a mention.

8/10!

title: Extremely fun, not much else
review: I went into this film thinking it was going to be extremely similar to one of my favorite anime, Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress. While the parallels are extremely easy to see, they are extremely different. No actual plot of this movie would I even consider mediocre. I think the dad and daughter relationship was set up fine, but I didn't feel any emotion in final scene. I just didn't really care, and obviously it's sad, but I just don't know enough about the characters to really feel emotion. There was one emotional part in the entire movie, that part being when the survivors are trying to get to safety after making their way through 4 cars, and Su-an was crying seeing people struggle to get the door open in front of her, and struggle to get the door closed behind her. That was easily the best scene of the entire movie, and the only part that went into anything deeper than a shallow zombie film. The other main plot, of the husband and his pregnant wife was fine, but nothing about it was really special. The dialogue of this film was definitely one of its weak points. There were huge long stretches of no dialogue when I think they could have really built up some of the characters in this time. It felt to me like this movie couldn't decide whether it wanted to be a fun action flick, or a deeper more emotional film. It tried to walk the line between both, and just did so very poorly. The worst of both were brought out. Overall I didn't hate this movie, but compared to other shows extremely similar, I would never recommend this over something like Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress.

title: As Promised. Action-packed quality!
review:
I first need to comment on many reviews that rave about the "cheerleader", her legs, and the hot girls. There are obviously some sick viewers/posters on IMDB.

The movie is great. Quality is high, action is non-stop, and the freshness in a worn out genre is amazing!

I recommend it here...and just have to some friends as well.

title: Train to zombieland
review:
Pl buckleup ur seats for this amazing thrilling suspenseful zombie ride .
There are so many wow ,sad & nail biting moments.
Everyone in movie acted like this is their last movie, esp zombie actors .Every zombie acted better than every other zombie .
Pl watch it with subtitles even if it's not in ur regional language .

title: Quite a ride! It was fun and action packed... and sad
review: I cried. yep! i actually cried in this zombie movie. Loved the characters and I'd love a sequel. thanks!!!!

title: The ego in the panic
review: The plans, the direction, the rhythm, the character development, swim do nothing without any reason, suspense well taken and perfect rhythm, the bad thing is the poor vfx and not showing the origin of the plague I think

title: Not a typical zombie movie
review:
Wow, this movie is incredibly intense emotionally. The characters are all designed very well, so even if they seem like bad people at times or have done something wrong, you still are rooting for them because they have learned from their wrongs and are obviously being affected by them (except for one guy). It was surprising how real some of the movie felt, in terms of it not being the typical movie where everything predictably just barely goes perfectly for the main characters. This movie didn't sacrifice realism for plot convenience as much as some other movies which made it very tense and gripping. That said, there definitely were some times that they used plot convenience to set up to play with the audience's emotions, but it wasn't overdone. At times, the acting was kind of off, but I tried thinking about how they should have acted in those situations instead and couldn't think of how to execute what needed to be done. Some of the situations were just way too intense emotionally to really even know how someone would actually react in them. I enjoyed the music and camerawork as they both added to the movie quite a bit. I don't have much negative to say about this film, it was really well done and way better and more thought provoking than I anticipated.

As for symbolism, themes, morals, etc., I didn't expect a zombie movie to be very deep, but Train to Busan really does force you to consider things. The main theme is finding a balance between sacrificing your own best interest for the good of others and putting yourself first. When should you ignore others in need to save yourself? Should you ever? How much of yourself should you sacrifice to help others? These questions are constantly addressed throughout the movie. The entire zombie outbreak was started because of negligence of the well being of others. There is a conflict between the father and his daughter in the beginning that is caused by him not being there in her life because he is always busy with work. His work has even caused his wife to leave him. He was obviously doing it all for his daughter's future, but when is the sacrifice too much and how should it be balanced properly? He learns early on that his daughter thinks of others a lot and does what she can for them, whereas he thinks only of himself a lot of the time which she notices and dislikes. As the story goes on, you can see a noticeable change in his actions as he becomes more and more giving until eventually he has to make the ultimate sacrifice to save his daughter. Along the way, some of his actions have almost instant karma where he will decide to risk helping someone and then they end up saving him soon after or he doesn't take the risk and it causes some sort of conflict for him. There are many characters who made great sacrifices for others and I think he saw that and always took note and saw the result of the sacrifice which helped him change and do the same. There is also a character who is entirely greedy and even sacrifices other for himself and although he does make it pretty far, he ends up infected which is very telling of where that route will get you.

All in all, I believe that Train to Busan is a great film all around and is entirely worth watching, whether you want an emotional, gripping, or thought provoking experience.

title: Could have been a 7.5
review: Why draw out of all things a Zombie film lol. The last decade since they replaced the Vampire craze they won't leave me alone lol. The social commentary is funny in a dark sense but can't really hit the nerve as it should because we're dealing with Zombies.. what made me drop this to a six was again length and an overbearingly cheesy attempt at a tearful ending it went from comical Zombie Apocalypse with screw the selfish to some sort of redemption...There's no room for redemption on that scale in a Zombie movie lol

title: Best Zombie Movie so farr
review: I absolutely loved this movie. The ending part made me cry. I have never cried before that hard. My best zombie movie so far.

title: Not just another zombie movie
review: While it does have many similar components to other zombie movies, this stands above and beyond most. The acting is good, as is the storyline. Exceptional cinematography. Well worth the watch.

title: EnterTraining film..
review: Really good roller coaster ride of horror and survival, after a zombie outbreak hits Korea and the passengers found a train have to fight to survive.

title: Awesome
review: I love zombie movies/shows and I know mosft of them suck but this one really surprised me. It is a great movie! From start to finish you're on the edge of your seat! And maybe even make you shed a tear or two? Lol loved it!

title: It is more than a zombie movie
review: This is the type of movie u should watch... Without a single minute boring.. Beginning till the end.. It was nail biting end..GREAT movie to watch its got all the contents..climax was super..

title: Good zombie flick
review: This is a nice zombie flick on a train, some elements were a bit cheesy but overall it's a nice zombie movie from Korea that all zombie fans genre should watch

title: Not as good as Resident Evil movies, but the main actor is the sexiest man I've seen!
review: It has some flaws, specially some scenes are a rip-off of War World Z movie, and predictable jumpcares like trash movies, for that I took some points off, it's not like many people say that it's the best zombie movie, but it's pretty entertaining, the main actor is extremely sexy by the way, and the acting are pretty good.

title: Unique Zombie Thriller
review:
A heart-wretching zombie thriller that keeps you glued to your seat from the get-go.

Presents a fresh breath to an already overbeaten zombie genre. Definitely a must-watch. Would recommend to friends.

4.5/5. More zombie movies should be like this.

title: Adrenaline!
review:
What an adrenaline rush!

This is a thrill-a-minute escape from zombie doom movie that combines the better parts of Snowpiercer with the basic premise of World War Z. There is a freshness to how the survivors wiggle out of one harrowing situation only to find themselves square in another . . . that is, until the last act when the movie descends into genre clichÃ©s and predictable action fare. Until then, though, be prepared to be short of breath and on the edge of your seat as a divorced father connects with his estranged daughter in the wildest way possible: on a zombie train!

title: So ridiculous that its funny
review: I am a fan of Gong Yoo, so I was unrealistically hopeful. Train to Busan was one of the most ridiculous Korean films I have ever watched. Despite this , it held my action to the end. What a bummer!

title: Surprisingly Good
review:
This is what I imagine what it might have been like in South Korea during the early days of the zombie outbreak seen in "World War Z."

The movie does a lot of things right, such as focusing on just a few main characters, keeping the story tight, and having a good mix of fast-paced action and down-times. Sure, its budget was super low compared to WWZ, but this did not in any way hamper the realism or the experience. If anything, I'm rather surprised by how well the movie was made with the money they had available.

In fact, it seems relatively very little CGI was used, even for the zombies, which actually makes the movie that much more believable and realistic.

With the exception of a few scenes, the acting was mostly superb. Many of the characters are completely believable, even in their frustratingly at times stupidity. The reality is that in times of crises, people behave differently, unexpectedly, and sometimes badly. But some also rise to the challenge. These behaviors are well represented in the movie.

The only thing that I found to be difficult to believe is that there weren't more zombies running around in Busan, a city with nearly 4 million people.

If you enjoyed WWZ, like I did, you'll definitely appreciate "Busanhaeng."

title: Original and Intense
review: The movie started off slowly for me but then I found myself really getting into it. The hero is at times hard to like but starts to redeem himself as things go on. The action scenes are great. The story arcs of the characters quite bold and and I was shocked at times as to the casualties. Nobody is safe in this movie. I found myself towards the end quite unsettled. Not because of the gore or violence but because of the deaths of some of the characters and also the horrible and vile nature of the baddie executive and the other commuters on the train. As always with these movies some of the human survivors are the real monsters amongst us.

title: Best movie
review: This the best movie among all zombie movoes i have watched. Teaches us what you give comes back to you !!

title: A good zombie flick
review:
I respect all genres. In zombie horror this movie impressed me. There were really scary and good jump scares. Off late, zombie movies are unnecessary material made and are same old stuff which is already shown in lot many other movies. However, this one was different.

A definite one time watch.

title: Impressed
review: I got to tell you, I was very impressed with this movie. It's a good solid zombie flick. The ending was pretty cool too.

title: Easy 10/10!
review: No questions asked! Just watch. 10/10 easy. No questions asked. 10/10.

title: I have had it with these mf zombies on this mf train!!!!
review:
Korean Zombies (think World War Z) on a train packed with passengers desperately trying to get to Busan. A decent supply of heroes and villains are whittled down in what provides a claustrophobic environment. The limitations of the train are often cleverly exploited with fewer contrived moments. Pace plays a massive role in the movie, that of the zombies and the train, this is balanced with elements of stealth and quiet. As with the best apocalyptic movies the reactions of those in peril and the challenges to social norms are well explored. The characters are earnest and sympathetic, if at times a bit one dimensional.
It does a hell of a lot with must have been a meagre budget, and there's plenty of fun to be had on this rollercoaster. The result may not be up there with the best (28 days/weeks later) but there's something undeniably cool about watching a foreign language action movie, so you can bracket this one with Nikita and The Raid. Not necessarily in terms of quality but in kudos earned. SEVEN

title: Gripping from start to finish - A high speed horror
review: The remake is already on the way so you know this is an excellent film. Action packed and full of truly interesting characters that you want to see survive till the end, Train to Busan transcends cultures to be nail bitingly tense, no matter where you're from. Watch it with a group of people and some popcorn for maximum effect.

title: This is how you make a Zombie movie
review:
An absolute blood fest zombie movie with zombies that make you feel genuine fear with there movement sounds and even dislocated body parts clicking and cracking against the bones as they move the tight spaces of the train gives a clostrophobic feeling especially when there's zombie in both directions and knowhere you can run too.

The movie follows a father and daughter who take a train journey to Busan for the daughters birthday but the same day a zombie outbreak occurs and as the train leaves the station a frantic woman boards the train who brings the infection with her and from one bite to the next the train quickly becomes overrun with zombies the passengers in a panic make it to the far end of the train and bar the door while hearing those behind them scream in terror but that was only beginning of this night now the survivors on the train must survive until they reach the end of the line if there is one anymore.

The movie is in Korean with English subtitles and I have to say the acting is very good from everyone involved the directing is marvelous the make up and effects look amazing the zombies look better than big budget Hollywood movies with lots of blood injury detail and the way the zombies body's move and contract is something I've never seen before it had me in Awww of just how amazing it looks.

I recommend this movie to any Horror movie and zombie fan it's worth your time 100% it's a zombie movie done right and with all the let down zombie movies of the modern day this movie shows Hollywood up and says this is how it's done.

title: incredible movie
review: Has the suspense, drama, horror, romance, and even a family aspect. this film leaves the viewer feeling the emotions of the characters.

title: Finally, a terrific zombie movie.
review:
In the last few years, especially about a decade ago, we were extremely flooded with zombie movies, both horror, comedy and even drama, however, a large majority of these ended up being mediocre movies and completely forgettable. Years later, in the middle of 2016, the fantastic South Korean filmmakers decide to change that and give us an entertaining, brilliant and original zombie story.

Filled with fantastic scenes, fast-paced action and fabulous performances, Train To Busan is a great zombie movie full of emotional moments and well-built suspense, set in what is a modern city and at the same time, the claustrophobic atmosphere of a train. The film is made to entertain, from beginning to end does not bore, finally a film of this type that is really worthwhile to pass the time. Good cinematography, great scenes, an intelligent script, complex characters, fantastic effects and sentimental scenes make of this movie a redemption for the genre, and as an extra, one more proof of the ability of South Koreans to make incredible movies.

title: what an exciting film
review: I tried watching a Korean movie for the first time & I was very surprised.. the film is very exciting & entertaining, I think it may be better from Hollywood zombie films. Respect for the film & the cast & I think I'll try watching ather Korean films

title: Moved to tears...
review: Oh man the child actress-phenomenal. I loved every second of this movie. The acting, the plot, the passion behind everyone and their stories. I mean, my goodness, foreign films rarely ever disappoint and this was no different. If you're in the mood for a quality zombie apocalypse movie, this is it!!!!

title: Hits All The Genre Tropes With Thrilling Aplomb, And Gives Food For Thought Also
review:
(ONE SLIGHT SPOILER)

Genre movies can get a rough critical ride - if a movie, film, book or whatever - hits all the expected beats and notes one might expect, it's easily dismissed. It's said to have done nothing meaningful, to be derivative. But as long as we've been telling stories, genres have been important - they provide comfort and a structure to tell a story that we feel safe with and understand.

Additionally, to dismiss genre art misses something very significant; many of humanity's greatest artists have worked within the strictures of the genre. Shakespeare is an example par excellence of this - most of his plays fit an established contemporary genre. What is exceptional in them is how he develops character and themes within these genres, whilst still pleasing those who came along for the comfort of the predictable (as well as the sublime language, of course).

South Korea action-horror movie Train To Busan is a genre movie with the highest of high concepts: zombies on a train. If that doesn't get a horror-action fan's juices flowing, then little will. It's stark and efficient; as characters board a train, a zombie outbreak (the word is only used once in the film) hits the world outside and inside the train. The action sequences are visceral and thrilling; making full use of the train's geography, and the rare sequences outside the train work equally effectively without disrupting the claustrophobic, trapped tone.

For the genre fan looking further, there's more to see. An incisive, satirically edged, take on the walls, customs and strictures we put around each other and others to protect our standing in families and societies.

(slight spoiler)

The fatal flaw of this zombie outbreak is that the zombies can only hunt what they can see. This means a couple of things - it adds some great wrinkles to action sequences when the train unpredictably enters or emerges from a tunnel, for example. But this idea also plays up the themes of the film, especially in the well-timed lull in advance of the film's final act as these ideas are given more space to breathe than in other similar films.

A key plot moment in the last twenty minutes tries to present some redemption and hope; I'm not convinced it works tonally or plot-wise; the ultimate conclusion a necessary upbeat that unsurprisingly allows a sequel should box office permit (it did - a sequel is in production).

It's not a perfect film, but this first live-action movie from the director promises much to watch with interest in years to come.

title: BEST EMOTIONAL ZOMBIE DISASTER ACTION FILM EVER MADE!!!!!!
review: Alright, so the only reason i didnt give this a 9 or 10 is because it needs a lot of action and violence for that but now for the review. This movie was clearly the best zombie disaster film ever made and the movie captures that and shows that very well. The only problem i have is that its not in English but in the end i dont really care and its not really about that. The ending is the real best part, it is very emotional and you are guaranteed to at least start to cry because i did. The zombie scenes in this movie are scary and super cool especially the first sighting of the zombies, omg you have to see this. This is like a whole new experience of scary. horror, and disaster. If this was rated r and had more gore and was in English then it would most likely be a 9 or a 10 but actually i think its better without it because it feels more sad and more realistic to the viewer. This movie is like a masterpiece in the end and there probably not another movie like this one. You have to see this movie. And the beginning was cool with the whole deer thing and that might be what cause the disease with something on the truck with the deer idk. Great movie overall and when i was watching this movie i didnt want it to end because of how good it was. A very good emotional disaster film.

title: Wow. One of the better zombie films out there.
review: Busanhaeng, more commonly known in the west as Train to Busan, focuses primarily on a hard-working man who frequently puts his work before his young daughter. The man, Seok-woo, takes his daughter on an early train headed from Seoul to Busan in order for her to see her mother. What happens when they board the train, well it is quite obvious what happens. Nevertheless, Train to Busan involved a broad range of characters, although they were cliche, that offered an experience of how people reacted to their surroundings and what they were willing to do in order to survive. There is relief and heartbreak along the way, but Train to Busan is certainly the best modern zombie film, and one of the best films I have recently seen. Train to Busan 2 is supposedly in the works for a 2020 release, and I cannot wait to see how the journey continues and what is next for our cast.

title: The train to Busan
review:
The Train to Busan is a thrilling horror unlike any I have seen before. Director Sang-ho Yeon puts his own spin on a large scale zombie outbreak, after a chemical lab releases a deadly virus. Unsuspecting passengers board a train that will cause them to see much more than the little girls mother. Innocent passengers must endure the seemingly never-ending train ride to Busan as they watch the cities of Korea fall around them, after a plant known for making mistakes releases the airborne virus. Although it as an apocalyptic style zombie fight-for-survival type movie, I wouldn't put it in the same category as some of the other prominent titles in the genre such as I Am Legend, or even World War Z.

Sang-ho Yeon added a new twist and stayed away from the typical 'tough guy gunning down zombies to save the world' approach of many similar movies, and focused on capturing the chaos happening during an apocalypse in the dense modern urban setting of South Korea. The characters consistently keep the audience on the edge of their seat because of the deeper emotional connection we are able to establish at the beginning by being able to relate to them. Because the language utilized in this movie is Korean it allowed me to focus more on character's emotions and facial expressions; this, however, does not take away from the film in my opinion. One of the key strengths of this film is the breathtaking camera work and shot choice, that helps engage the audience on a new level as we are immersed into their world. A large range of film techniques are used in this film and the utilization of subjective point of view shots greatly add to the already immersive film. South Korea being the setting of the film gives the audience an inquisitive urge to keep watching as each turn and bend is foreign to us. The director's definitive choice of setting for each shot aids the suspense and "on your toes" feeling for the duration of the movie. Unlike many of the other apocalyptic movies many of us have seen, the acting in this film is absolutely phenomenal. Going into this movie I had very low expectations for quality of acting, especially since I did not recognize any of the cast from previous movies. Each actor elegantly played their roles and spared no emotion. This blew me away as most other movies I've seen like this have focused on making a few characters look badass as they power their way through crowds of zombies, but this movie was different. Each character felt real and as the audience we really connect with them, feeling like we would have made the same choices.

A combination of intricate detailed set pieces, carefully chosen shots, and remarkable acting took this seemingly average zombie apocalyptic movie, to an invigorating emotionally engaging thriller that contracted my attention throughout. Not once did I feel like checking my phone or going to the bathroom, as this movie had me completely immersed from the opening scene to the the final credits.

title: Tense and suspenseful
review:
Needed to set up an account so I could write a review that focused on the movie, instead of some creepy ass review of the attractiveness of the women in the movie. Seriously, get it together dudes.

The first 10-15 minutes on the train build tension perfectly. So many little, freaky puzzle pieces that come together at just the right time and then never. Ever. Stop.

I liked this take on zombie lore. It's claustrophobic. It gives enough character development so that it's not just blood and gore. But it definitely has a good amount of blood and gore, if that's your thing. I've now watched this movie a second time and the suspense and tension still holds up.

title: Good movie for people and zombies
review: Excellent film recommended by my daughter RJ. I wish all films were this good and agree with her that character development, story lines, pace, everything just top notch. It also does something else; it makes you want to seek out films by this director and see more. I can't wait to watch it again.

title: IT'S INTERESTING!! LET'S WATCH IT
review:
Actually, at first I'm not really interesting about this movie. Almost all of my friends talk about this movie a lot. Although a little bit late, finally i had watched this movie and i like it so much.
This is a Korean movie which about zombies attack in the train. The story is amazing and I as a viewer can't guess anything during I watch it. During watching this movie I also can feel the emotions felt by the actors and actresses. That fear, worry, and disgust when I see the zombie.
And I think, this movie is not just about a zombie movie. There's a implied message that tells us about humanity. How to be kind each other even though you don't know that person. How to helping each other in urgent circumstances. And how not to think just about yourself.
I am also surprised that I had cried when I saw one of the scene I feel really touched my heart. It teach that love between a children and their parents is truly pure. Although sometimes their actions show otherwise, but that is only to cover up their pride.
I just want to say, I RECOMENDED THIS MOVIE!! So don't you dare, you're not watch this movie hahaha

title: Zombie Train straight to hell...
review: This movie is just a fantastic ride. Literally. Well not for them. The nearly non-stop train reflects the non-stop fight for survival. Even after so many zombie movies have been and gone, it's great that we still get new 'versions' and new environments to experience them in. There's some great "oh god, get OUT of there quick!" moments that are so much fun. I love my zombies, and this didn't disappoint!

title: Interesting And Abit scary
review: Should have more jumpscare and More gun actions,Further more 7/10 I like the zombies and The main characters.Keep it up! More zombies movie in the future(IRON MAN DIED IN ENDGAME!,SPOILERRRR)

title: Train to Busan
review:
Train to Busan (Busanhaeng) is a South Korean survivalist zombie movie.

It owes more to the Hollywood disaster movies on the 1970s such as The Poseidon Adventure or the Airport films.

Seok-woo is a divorced fund manager. A workaholic who never has much time for his young daughter Su-an. They board a train so she can visit her mother. An injured young woman scrambles onto the train before it leaves Seoul. She had been bitten and becomes infected by some type of virus that turns her into a flesh eating zombie.

As she bites others, they too become infected and in turn attack other passengers and staff. Some of the survivors try to move quickly to the safe carriages.

Survivors include Seok-woo and his daughter, a pregnant woman and her macho husband, two elderly sisters, members of a high school baseball team, a selfish tycoon and a few others. As the train journey continues, they get picked off one by one.

The zombies have been inspired by World War Z as at times they can be fast moving. The director has done well in maintaining tension and a claustrophobic atmosphere before moving the action to other places.

The characters are nicely fleshed out and this is one of the better zombie movies.

title: The very definition of a mondo midnight movie!
review: Part horror and part satire, this is an exceptional movie that drags you screaming along at bullet-train speed. Extraordinary tension is counterbalanced with eerie calm, as survivors embark and disembark in quiet fear.

title: Has the look and feel of a B movie, but this zombie movie turns out to be a rather good one. Great frenzy and gore. Riveting suspense and unnerving fight for survival.
review:
Didnt expect much of it at first. Looked like a cheap B movie, because of the low budget for special effects. But that low budget for special effects turns out to be a good thing, because what we get instead of boring CGI effects is great real life mass pursuits of zombies. And instead of boring CGI we get a lot of real life unnerving close up fights for survival with zombies in a high speed train.

Yes, the bloody zombies dont look particularly convincing, but their frenzy is terrific nonetheless. Yes, for those nitpickers who complain about apparent loopholes in the story, there are indeed some, but they dont affect the movie's suspense. The actors arent particularly great either, but their characters are quite convincing nonetheless.

Despite all these minor let downs I got really swept away with this suspenseful story about a korean dad, who wants to protect his young daughter from zombie attacks on a train. The "zombies on a train" theme is rather interesting as well. All in all a really surprising, enjoyable and even emotionally touching zombie movie. 7 stars, but I will upgrade to 8 stars if this movie still stands strong after a second viewing.

title: Collision course with zombies.....and emotions
review:
Train to Busan is a decent zombie movie that focusses less on horror/gore, and more on people and emotions. Without a real intro, the watcher is thrown in the middle of the movie, already overrun by zombies, while a group of survivors try to escape by train. But the horrors continu on the train, as it seems that zombies are not the only monsters.

The effectiveness of this movie is thanks to the great actors who portray the spastic and quick zombies, without relying on gore. Another effect is the amazing acting by father and daughter, pregnant woman and boyfriend, and the "evil" rich man who doesn't care about others. The movie obviously focusses on humanity, choises and effects.

That's also the flaw of the movie. After a while it becomes repetitive and the roles become cliche. The "evil" rich man becomes a cliche to a point that it becomes caricatural. This doesn't bring the movie down, because the pacing is so fast, that you'll never get bored or stuck in a situation. Train to Busan is still one of the better zombie movies in years.

title: Molecule Review: Train to Busan (6 Stars)
review: Just like any other zombie film, Sang-ho Yeon's Train to Busan starts and ends like you would expect it to be unless you deep dive into the dialogues between the characters that create a much more emotional impact on you. There's a biomedical threat engulfing the city of Seoul and its neighboring areas when a selfish fund manager has to take his daughter to her mom (they are separated) in Busan. But they don't know what's coming to hunt them. How these two characters plus a bunch of other ones try to save themselves from the impulsive zombies forms the crux of this horror thriller that has some insane CGI work to keep you hooked. I watched the Hindi dubbed version (with English subtitles), so naturally the effect was a bit low if you are not a Korean native. But I found Train to Busan to be an emotional drama about relationships and their absence more than it is about a zombie apocalypse. You have to decide if that's a good thing or a bad thing. TN.

title: One way ticket to FlavorTown
review:
Listen, do yourself a favor and get the EXPRESS PASS on this one.

Train to Busan was insanely too long...I live for zombie movies, but this one was putting me to sleep after about an hour. I went and made some tea 🍵, seriously.

No real story line here...yeah, zombies, still needs a decent storyline, IMO. The characters are all pretty ridiculous, most notably the Korean, Smash Mouth, ICP, Guy Fieri - looking dude with the pregnant wife.

Decent enough acting, pacing, violence, special FX, weird zombie seizures, and plenty of blood.

I think they just tried to pack too much in, with a whole lot of nothing going on, on such a short train ride. This is a better luck next time flick for me.

Thanks for riding!

4/10 🔥🔪🔥🔪

title: Pale acting, no story
review:
Pale acting, no story line. I don't recommend it for anyone, unless you wanr to kill the time by watching anything.

If you are the type of people who criticises the story and acting: run away.

title: Not Bad, But Could've Been Better!
review:
This 2016 horror-thriller tells of a businessman and his young daughter
trying to survive aboard a train along with others during a zombie apocalypse. This isn't bad, but could've been better mainly because of the last half hour.
It does have good make-up effects, a decent cast, some tense & sad moments.
If you're into zombie or foreign horror flicks, give it a try.

title: Scary fun!
review:
This movie was literally a Korean Version of World War Z because of it's action. Unlike going across the world to find a origin of the virus this is more of surviving on a train with a bunch of characters that you can actually remember unlike some movies where they introduce the character but don't go as much in-depth. I also liked how they somewhat had a basis on what happened.
What I didn't like were the first 15 minutes. When the man ran over the deer and the deer got reanimated I never understood it's purpose rather than the zombies are rising. I never understood much also of the main character's business and work, maybe if they added 5 minutes somewhere in the beginning of him talking more to his Mother it would've added more sentimental value.

title: Good story and plot, however the suspense is forced
review:
I was hesitant to watch another zombie movie but after all the positive user reviews, I decided to give it a go.

This is an overall good movie apart from one major detail. Most of the suspense is created by making characters act irrational or slow. This is an "easy", effective suspense, but truly annoying. There is no need for it.

Great SFX nevertheless.

(ATM I have 500+ ratings but this is my first review, mostly because I am a bit annoyed at this movie and the overrated user reviews).
